loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leoniza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening. Leoniza is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Leoniza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Semben

texts.en:
Mr. Semben is 42 years old and lives with his wife and their two sons in the Ger in Ih toiruu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife Oyuntogtoh is 40 years old works as a chef in a cafeteria. His older son, Sodnombaljir, is 19 years old and serves in the military. His younger son, Demberel, is 11 years old and studies at a local school.

Ms. Oyuntogtoh has been working as a chef for 21 years and has lot of experience in the business. She has been working in this particular cafeteria for three years and now rents a small cafeteria of her own to increase the family's income.

Semben has been helping his wife start a family business of running a small cafe. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of (food) inventory so that they can start their business before the Mongolian National Holiday, which is the high season for the food business.

loans.use: to capitalize on demand by purchasing a large amount of food inventory for a new family cafeteria business

loans.name: 01.07.15 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
An has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She has been involved in this business for one year. She is requesting a loan to purchase more material to make iron furniture.

An is 61 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 01.07.15 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents because her children are grown up. 

In 2010, An joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, An hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more material to make iron furniture.

loans.name: 02.01.12 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Phong has a manufacturing business making nem chua (fermented/cured pork). She has been involved in this business for one year. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to make fermented/cured pork.

Phong is 36 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Phong is the group leader of the 02.01.12 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2012, Phong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phong has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. In the future, Phong hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase pork to make fermented/cured pork.

loans.name: 04-09-03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Tỵ operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase tea, drinks, candy, milk, and biscuits to resell.

Tỵ is 62 years old and she is single with two children. Tỵ is the group leader of the 04-09-03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of six members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents because her children are grown up.

In 2009, Tỵ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tỵ faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Tỵ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase tea, drinks, candy, milk, and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.en: Bernardino resides in the village of San Guillermo in the province of Isabela. He is 56 years old, married and blessed with three children. He is a hard-working and responsible father. He owns and operates a general store in his village and it is his main source of income. He has been engaged in this business for almost two years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month. Bernardino has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase items for his retail store such as noodles, canned goods, bakery bread, curls, and daily-use products. He hopes that his requested loan will be granted so that he can utilize it properly in his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase items for his retail store such as noodles, canned goods, bakery bread, curls, and daily use products

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas works hard to support her family. Felicitas is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. The fiber from the abaca palm leaf is used for handicraft production. Felicitas requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business. Felicitas has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her abaca weaving business. In the future, Felicitas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising oysters. Mary Ann is borrowing 24000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is 48 years old and married with 4 children, two of whom are in school. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ronnie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ronnie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Ronnie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Ronnie would like to save money to expand his business and continue to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 46 years old, married with six children and four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap, 27, lives in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province in Cambodia. She is married with one daughter. 

Leap and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing cassava and have done so for several years. The current business earns her about 84,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day, and she can save about 40,000 KHR per day for future needs. 

Leap is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund for 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes to grow her current business to increase her family’s income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Aged 38 years, Pov is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and planting cassava and oranges, which she has been doing for 10 years. Pov can earn about 40,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future.

This is the second loan for Pov with VisionFund. She has used the first loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now, she is requesting another loan of 2,000,000 KHR with VisionFund, and she is going to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her cultivated land. She will use a portion of it to spend on buying gasoline for water pumping. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman aged 26 years old. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 1 sack of maize, beans, and wheat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 1 sack of maize, beans, and wheat for resale.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman of four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from her home to her neighbours. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES she has requested she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is getting ahead and makes an effort to grow. She says that she has good experience in this area because she has been doing this for a long time. She also says that the previous Kiva loan allowed her to make many improvements and continue to grow. Susan’s goal is to continue expanding her business.

Susan is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as meats, fruits, drinks, vegetables, and other things for her food cafe so she can continue to offer services to her customers. She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as meats, fruits, drinks, vegetables, and other things

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with four school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Margaret has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to receive financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman. She lives with her three children, one of whom attends school. She started her business by buying clothing and other products to resell. She has built up a very good customer base because of her good pricing and variety of products. With her work, she helps her family. For this reason, she wants to be able to invest in her business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other garments because these are in high demand this season. She is grateful for this opportunity because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other garments.

loans.name: Mwajumbe

texts.en: Mwajumbe is married and lives with her husband Rashid, she’s very happy with him. She owns a small, well-stocked grocery store where she works very hard every day. She’s had her small business for three years. Thanks to her work and sacrifice, it’s been growing. She also relates that her husband always helps her in everything he can, which also helps her business to grow. Mwajumbe requests the loan to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions and other products needed to stock the store to continue growing and providing customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and other products

loans.name: Mackline

texts.en:
Mackline is married and has one child under his care. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Mackline operates a barber shop business and he faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business and also competition from fellow barbers.

With the loan that he is requesting he wants to purchase 3 chairs and a hair cut machine for the efficiency of his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 chairs and a hair cut machine for the efficiency of his business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi tells us that her goal is to maintain and strengthen her workplace. This is why she has come to Yehu Microfinance, and she is grateful to them for having given her the opportunity to obtain this loan for stocking her business with foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other products that she sells every day. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard for her family and she is asking for the opportunity to continue to grow. She is asking for a loan to purchase various types of vegetables and more corns for sale. For this reason she wants to have her business stocked. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she is given since this will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase various types of vegetables and more corns for sale.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said has operated a store for seven years. His business has been doing very well because he has a loyal customer base. He explains that his customers are so loyal because of his excellent service and because he operates the best-stocked store in the neighborhood. As a result of these factors, he has enjoyed lots of success. 

He dreams of being able to continue to grow the business so that he can earn enough to help his wife with the household expenses. He is now requesting this loan to buy additional items such as drinks, sugar, rice, and flour, as these his the best-selling products. He is grateful for the help he is receiving, and says that the loan proceeds will be very useful.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing additional inventory of his best-selling products (e.g., drinks, sugar, rice, and flour)

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun is married. She lives with her husband and has two small children. Both parents work tirelessly to support them. 

For the past year the couple has made and sold clothing for women, men and children. Thanks to their hard work they now have a well-developed clientele. 

Because of the many orders they receive, Zaitun and her husband are applying for a 50,000 KES loan through Yehu to be used to buy additional fabric. In this way they will be able to keep up with all of their orders.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 19-year-old single man who has worked as a house painter since 2006. Husein didn't have the chance to continue his education; he stopped attending school during his elementary education.

His family's financial situation forced him to start working so early and quitting school. Today he is a hard worker, well known in his region for his commitments and the special quality of work provided. He also has two employees who help him meet additional customer needs. 

Husein is having slight problems in his business that has to do with transportation.  So he is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy a car (Renault Rapid or a small van) that will help him transport all his tools and his employees easily from one project they are working on to another.

This loan will help him facilitate his work a lot, making transportation easier and decreasing expenses.

As for Husein's future plans, he is working hard to stay capable of facing the wide competition around him by developing and providing special customer service.

loans.use: To buy a small car (Renault Rapid or small van) to facilitate his work

loans.name: El Gran Chaparral Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “El Gran Chaparral” en el poblado de Patria.  

Olinda tiene 32 años de edad y vive en el poblado de Patria, ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes  y gallinas. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más gallinas y cuyes para incrementar su capital de negocio. 

Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta de madera, venta de ropa, venta de comida, a la crianza de animales menores, a la venta de golosinas y otras cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

(El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the "El Gran Chaparral" communal bank in the village of Patria.

Olinda is 32 years old and lives in the village of Patria. She's a responsible and kind person who gets ahead because of her main business, which is raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. On this occasion she requests the loan in order to purchase more chickens and guinea pigs so she can increase her working capital.

This communal bank is comprised of various people who continuously seek opportunities to get ahead and provide a better future for their children through their daily efforts. The members work in farming, selling wood, selling clothing, selling food, raising small animals, and selling snacks and other items.

The members in general give thanks for the opportunity they've been given and pledge to comply with their individual repayments within schedule.

(The village of Patria is known for the trade of forest produce and also for lodging services and restaurants. It's an entry point to Manu National Park.)

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Batkhuu

texts.en: Batkhuu, 46 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) next to their own grocery store. His elder son studies at university while his younger son goes to high school. He has a leg disability and uses crutches. Due to his disability, he gets a pension from the state and his wife executes the role of caretaker. In 2012, he rented a counter at an outdoor market and began selling additives such as ketchup, mayonnaise, pepper, garlic, onion and curry. He is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to purchase food stuffs in large quantities, so that he and his wife can run their grocery store without worrying about stock shortage. This one family is a perfect example of how a simple loan can change one's life.

loans.use: to purchase food stuffs in large quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fees in order to validate her college diploma.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard, age 47 years, acquired a loan amount of 800,000 UGX. He is married with three children, all of school age, and one orphan. He is a coffee trader in Buzenga Rubirizi, a rural area. He works for 7 hours per day, every day of the week.  He also owns a retail shop as another source of income. He started his business in 2001 with the purpose of supporting his family. He will use money to increase his stock of coffee as well as the retail shop. In the future he hopes to progress and to also start his own coffee hauling factory like his colleagues in the area, and he fights so hard to get out of the poverty that is on rampage in the area. His major challenge is the unfavorable weather conditions that affect his business drastically. He thanks the lenders for their efforts to reach communities.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive con sus padres, y cuenta que está estudiando la carrera de derecho. Su mayo sueño es poder ser una profesional y poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Quiere ser abogada para poder ayudar a las personas que necesitan, Cuenta que después de terminar la carrera quiere seguir estudiando para poder seguir creciendo ya que uno nunca termina de aprender.
Solicita de este crédito para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir cubriendo sus estudios. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Diana is from the city of Pilar. She lives with her parents and is studying law. Her greatest dream is to be able to be a professional and to help her family through her work.
She wants to be a lawyer so that she can help those in need. She tells us that after finishing her degree she wants to keep studying so that she can keep growing; we never stop learning.
She is requesting this loan in order to cover her university tuition; this way she will be able to keep paying for her studies. She is very grateful for this opportunity, since it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Meyling Suyen

texts.es: Estudiante de la carrera de Medicina y Cirugía es la joven Meyling de 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo, ella no trabaja aun, se dedica por completo a sus estudios los cuales le gusta mucho porque se identifica mucho con la carrera y espera en un futuro ayudar a muchas personas. Meyling por dificultades económicas no había podido culminar sus estudios, aun con la ayuda de sus padres. Es por eso que ella solicita el crédito para cancelación de aranceles pendientes para poder estar al día y continuar la carrera, lo que le permitirá seguirse desarrollando para brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en: Meyling, age 29, is studying medicine and surgery. She is a single mother of one and does not work yet; she is a full-time student. She loves her studies because she feels good in this role and hopes to help many people in the future. Because of economic difficulties, Meyling has not been able to finish her studies, even with her parents' help. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to pay her pending tuition so that she can catch up and continue her studies. This will allow her to continue to become educated and to offer her child a better future.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: La  Vida Plena  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Vida Plena está formado por 2 socios y 8 socias quienes viven por los alrededores del cantón Paute, lugar que goza de grandes paisajes gracias a su geografía, tiene un clima templado propicio para el cultivo de varias frutas, también en este lugar se cultivan las más hermosas flores. Su gente es amable y muy gentil, se dedican a diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares, su mayor orgullo es que aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Rosa que un miembro fundador del grupo de crédito La Vida Plena, le gusta su grupo de crédito porque en cada reunión recibe charlas de educación y puede platicar con sus amigas de varios temas de su interés.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 38 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 15 y 12 años que están estudiando en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado y la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la cría y venta cuyes y cerdos, también siembra alfalfa que la vende por su cantón. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes de mejor calidad y también en semillas de alfalfa. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The La Vida Plena group is made up of two men and eight women who live around the Paute canton, a place blessed by beautiful countryside. Thanks to its geography, it has a temperate, favourable climate  for the cultivation of various fruit. The most beautiful flowers are also grown here. The people are kind and very courteous. They work in various jobs which allow them to contribute to their household economies. Their greatest pride is that they still maintain their culture and traditions.
One of the group members is Rosa, a founding member of the La Vida Plena group. They like their group because they get educational talks in every meeting, and they can talk to their friends about various themes that interest them.
Rosa is 38, married, and has three children ages 19, 15, and 12 who attend a local school. Her husband is a private employee and they live in their own home.
Rosa raises and sells guinea pigs and hogs. She also plants alfalfa and sells it in her canton.
She will invest this loan in the purchase of higher-quality guinea pigs and alfalfa seeds.
Her dream is for her children to become very good professionals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and alfalfa seeds.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 54 years old. She lives in Samtredia District with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, an infant grandchild, and her mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. Nanuli requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow and 2 calves, whose milk is used in cheese products. They sell approximately 15-20 kg. cheese during a month at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nanuli requested a loan from Credo to start-up the family business. Nanuli has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Nanuli will purchase all the needed equipment and open a wood workshop. As the needed equipment is bought, they will be able to produce wooden materials for selling. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase the needed equipment and start producing wooden furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 56 years of age, single, and living harmoniously together with her father. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 9 years and earns a net income of Php 200 daily. She would like to avail a loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase canned goods, curls, spices, candies, breads, biscuits, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will become more profitable and have a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, curls, spices, candies, breads, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Aurora Celina

texts.es:
La Señora. Celina se encuentra en el grupo de crédito 26-71 desde hace 3 años tiempo en el que ha establecido una mejor relación de amistad con todas sus amigas. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada por grande paisajes, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es alegre y muy trabajadora que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Celina tiene 66 años de edad, es soltera y no ha concebido hijos, la casa en la que vive es de herederos.
 
Doña Celina se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de cosméticos, empezó solo con una marca y poco a poco ha ido ampliando las marcas y mercadería en su negocio, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin horario y en su casa también ofrece su producto. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de oferta para continuar creciendo en su negocio. 

Su sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Celina has been a member of the communal bank "26-71" for 3 years.  Over this time, she has strengthened her bond of friendship with all of the members.  

Celina lives in the city of Cuenca.  This is a city that is surrounded by beautiful countrysides, and it has been a UNESCO World Heritage site since December of 1999.   Its people are friendly and hardworking, and they still preserve the culture and traditions of their villages.

Celina is 66 years old, single, and never had children.  She lives in a house that she inherited.

For 15 years, Celina has been selling cosmetics.  She started out with only one brand, and gradually expanded the brands and merchandise in her business.  She works Mondays through Saturdays with no set schedule, and she also sells her products from her house.

She will invest the funds from her loan in the purchase of cosmetics to sell so that she can continue to grow her business.

Celina's dream is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María esta realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito 26-71, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada por grande paisajes, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es alegre y muy trabajadora que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 36 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo está en colegio y su segundo hijo en pre kínder. Su esposo es chofer profesional y presta sus servicios en un taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. María es una mujer emprendedora que tiene varios negocios, tiene unas cabinas telefónicas y una abacería y licorería desde hace 7 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 7 a 12 de la noche y los fines de semana las 24 horas, también hay días que se dedica a realizar masajes.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de licores para su licorería.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María is taking out her first loan on Kiva with her friends and fellow members of the 26-71 group. She lives in the community of Cuenca, which is surrounded by rolling countryside. As of December 1999 it is a World Heritage Site. The people are happy and very hard-working, and they still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.
Maria is 36, married, and has two children ages 13 and 4. Her eldest child is in school, and her youngest is in pre-kindergarten. Her husband is a professional taxi driver. They do not have their own home, so they rent.
Maria is an enterprising woman who has several businesses. She has had some phone booths, a grocery store, and a liquor store for seven years. She works Monday to Friday from 7:00 am to 12:00 am, and she works a full 24 hours on the weekends. Some days she also provides massages.
She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of liquor for her liquor store.
Her dream is that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Qurbat

texts.en:
Qurbat, 50, is the married father of 5 children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He has dedicated 20 years of his life to agriculture. Qurbat usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN, and this business is only one source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Qurbat also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 

He has already taken 4 loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for a 5th loan of 1900 AZN, which he will use to purchase three cattle and one milk cow .With this money, he wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions. Qurbat awaits your support.

loans.use: to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Suhbaatar is 62 years old and lives with his wife in a ger in the Dornogovi province of Mongolia. His wife Batdulam is retired and stays home tailoring traditional costumes for local clients. His four children are married and live elsewhere. Suhbaatar is a repeat borrower of XacBank and has good previous loan records. He has been driving taxi for years has lot of experience. He is now requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and replace them in order to continue his business without delay. He is a hardworking, diligent, and kind man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and replace them in order to continue his transportation business without delay.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca, who is married, is 51 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Francisca sells fish to earn a living while her husband fishes and has had this business for more than 16 years. She earns 2,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Aside from fishing, she also manages a coconut farm, harvesting it for sale. Recently, she has borrowed a loan of 7,500.00 PHP from GDMPC to buy fertilizer such as manure. Francisca has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and improve her farm as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Despertar  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de Crédito Despertar está formado por 8 mujeres que son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, laboran en diferentes actividades como es el comercio y prestan sus servicios como empleadas privadas, todas son amables y gentiles que a pesar de las adversidades tratan de salir adelante. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que tiene una arquitectura colonial y moderna, es de un clima frió y tiene hermosos lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gastronomía es muy variada y su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María Augusta y está realizando su primer crédito, tiene 35 años, es una madre soltera de una niña de 10 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña María Augusta tiene un negocio propio, ella prepara y vende comida, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo y lleva 7 años en su negocio el cual va creciendo poco a poco, pero, le hace falta un poco mas de capital para la compra de sus productos. 

El dinero de su crédito es para  comprar una nueva vajilla y víveres. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Despertar" is made up of 8 women who are very hardworking and tenacious.  They work in different activities, such as retail trade, and some of them work as private employees.  All of the members are kind and gentle people who, in spite of the adversities they face, are trying to get ahead.  They live in the city of Cuenca, which has colonial and modern architecture, a cold climate, and beautiful places to enjoy nature.  The cuisine is varied, and the people still maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

One of the members of this group is Maria Augusta, who is taking her first loan.  She is 35 years old, and is the single mother of a 10 year-old girl who attends a local school.  She does not own a home, so she lives in a rented dwelling.

Maria Augusta has her own business preparing and selling food.  She works Mondays through Saturdays without a set schedule.  She has had this business for 7 years, and it has been growing gradually.  However, she lacks sufficient capital to buy her products.

She will use the funds from this loan to buy new crockery and food.  

Maria Augusta's dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy new crockery and food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric or gas-consuming car for her husband to start a taxi service business in town.

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en: A father of eight children, three of whom are in school, Roeurn grows rice on four hectares of land to support the daily basic needs of his family. He lives in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. Roeurn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past five cycles and he has fully repaid back his past loans with success. His previous loans have upgraded his living condition in a good pace. Now he and his fellow group member are seeking a new loan with VisionFund of the amount 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and gasoline for his farmland. He hopes that he can earn more income to feed his family and set aside some money for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and gasoline for his farmland.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es alumno regular de la carrera Contabilidad, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá. Cuenta que es muy trabajador y que se dedica al macate, es decir, a la venta ambulante.
Tiene como sueño e ideal recibirse como contador y trabajar en una empresa de prestigio nacional e internacional y por medio de su trabajo poder ayudar a su familia de la misma forma en que los lo hacen.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y seguir estudiando. El se ve el día de mañana como un profesional que quiere crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Roberto is a regular student of Accounting from the city of Carapegua. They say he is a very hard worker who dedicates his free time to “macate,” that is, to street vending.

His dream and ideal is to finish his degree in Accounting and work for a prestigious national or international enterprise, and by means of his work, to aid his family in the same way they aided him.

Roberto is requesting this loan for use in paying his university fees so that he can continue his studies. He sees himself tomorrow as a professional who wishes to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: pay his university fees.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un estudiante de la ciudad de San Ignacio, quien sigue la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial. Comenta que hoy se encuentra en el segundo año de la carrera, dedicándose por ir mejorando cada día.
Dice también que es su familia quien lo inspira en luchar por sus estudios, ya que quiere poder ayudarles por medio de todo lo que el ha podido aprender.
El solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases, como así también para poder pagar las cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma seguir estudiando y esforzándose por estar cada día mas cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Francisco is a student in the city of San Ignacio who is studying commercial engineering.  He says that he is in his second year of his major, dedicating himself to improving each day.  He also says that it is his family who inspires him to work hard in his studies since he wants to help them through everything he has been able to learn.  He is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in paying for his classes and to be able to pay for his school fees.  In this way, he will keep studying and striving to be closer to his goal every day.

loans.use: to pay for university classes and fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and tools, with which to start her own tailoring business

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 49-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of two children. Iman is a Palestinian refugee, living in a Palestinian camp like most of the other Palestinians in Lebanon. Iman used to work in agriculture, but she began to feel sick and tired from such work. That is why she turned to a line of work that does not require too much effort. She opened a grocery store in 2007. The income that she earns running the store is necessary, to help her husband in making their living. Her husband works making fishing nets, which is hard work with a very low income that barely covers their needs.

Iman is taking her fifth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise by adding special summer beverages and ice cream.

Her previous loans helped her a lot in developing her newly-established business, and she proved to be reliable in paying back her loans. She is a borrower in good standing. Iman is working hard, to keep on developing and expanding her business in a greater way, and she is hoping to start wholesale trading in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise, by adding special summer beverages and ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her daughter's education fee, purchase a laptop for her to access the Internet and support her education

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a 57-year-old woman, married to a farmer who manages their farmland. The couple has six children. Esperanza wants a good future for her children and hopes to support their growing needs. She started managing her general store almost 20 years ago, wanting to earn more income for her family.

She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000. She will use it to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, bread and beverages. She's hoping that the loan she requested will be granted, so that her business will improve and become profitable.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, bread and soft drinks

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en: Rezo is 48 years old and lives in the Akhmeta district with his wife, son and a daughter-in-law. Rezo has requested several previous loans from local financial institutions for his family business start-up but without success. His loan requests have been rejected many times because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only income source for the family is the small amount earned by Rezo working as an artisan locally. Rezo is requesting a loan from Credo to restart his family business, which he had to stop due to financial problems. He will use his loan to purchase two pregnant pigs for starting an animal husbandry business. He will put the pigs in a shed in the yard and after several months the family will be able to sell the piglets for a good price. Rezo's loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program supports the rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Rezo's new business initiative, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for starting an animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Sultonbek

texts.en:
Sultonbek is a kind and industrious young man. He is 27 years old, married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that three years ago he began own transportation business. Thanks to the good service he provides, Sultonbek has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving. Sultonbek is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to repair his car. 
He then will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income which will allow him to offer his wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his car which is the source of his income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some spare parts for his motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun is 50 years old, married and has seven children, one still dependent on her and in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for several years in her village. The current business earns her family about 40,000 KHR per day. 
Oun has been with VisionFund for five loans and completely repaid the past loans that have helped her better support her children's education and relieve her family’s financial burden. Now, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her child in school and increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Musili

texts.en: Musili is a 31-year-old married man who has three children whose ages range from 1 to 6 years. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he drives passengers to different areas in Thika. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand his business. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle. His business goal is to have a fleet of motorcycles within five years. This is his first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
Eang, 54, is a married mother of three children and lives in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. To support her family, Eang has been raising pigs for 10 years in the village. The current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day.
Eang’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. Eang is requesting her sixth loan from VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support her family and business. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Eang, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes to fatten and sell her pigs to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for raising

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a 48-year-old, married mother of three children. She has been working in arranging and selling artificial flowers, in addition to gifts, since twelve years ago. Her husband is a farmer, and their combined, low income isn't enough to cover their additional, unexpected needs. That's why she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua.

She will invest the loan in their land's restoration and in buying requested fertilizers, to help her husband in developing his farming business. This investment of the loan will help them improve the productivity of their farmland, which will positively affect their socioeconomic situation. Two of their children work in order to cover their own needs. Aziza and her husband are working hard to help their third child to finish his university degree. They put  much hope in this child's education, since Aziza had the chance to reach the intermediate level unfortunately.

Aziza hopes to develop her own business and start decorating weddings, in the future.

loans.use: to restore their farmland, which her husband works, and to buy fertilizers, improving the land's productivity

loans.name: Nethale

texts.en:
Nethale is married with three children. She is 41 years old and lives in Prenza, Tangub City. Nethale owns and operates a plot of farmland where she plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than ten years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. 

Now, she requests a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.  In the future, Nethale's plan is to save her returns in order to buy another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Sarat, 30, is married and lives with her husband and three children, in a village of the Sangke district, Battambang province. All of her three children are dependents and under school-aged. Sarat and her husband are rice farmers, and they supplement their family’s income by working for others, for a fee. She has been in the rice farming business for 10 years, earning about 38,000 KHR per day, to feed her family.
 
Sarat’s group is comprised of two members, both of them female. Sarat is a first-loan-cycle client of VisionFund. Now she is leading her group, to request a new loan. Sarat, who is the leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income, to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes and pawpaws

loans.name: Kimheat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Sangke district, Kimheat is a 54-year-old father of three children. He and his wife are rice farmers in the village. Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from their current business and can manage to save about 7,000 KHR each day.

Kimheat is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald Bernardo trabaja como empleado fabril en la fábrica de muuebles de suspensión “FAMAC” ubicado en camino a Oruro Km. 7 de El Alto. Su esposa Yasmín trabaja como empleada en el Ministerio de Educación ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz. Ambos perciben salarios básicos  Viven en casa de sus familiares como cuidadores. En la zona 6 de marzo en la ciudad de  El Alto.
 
Ronald necesita credito para educación superior lo cual le permitirá acceder a mejores oportunidades laborales y mejorar su calidad de vida

El sueño de Ronald Bernardo, es tener una profesión.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ronald Bernardo works in a furniture factory for "FAMAC", located along the highway to Oruro at kilometer 7 of El Alto. His wife, Yasmín, works in the Ministry of Education, located in the city center of La Paz. Both Ronald and Yasmín earn basic salaries. They live with some relatives in the zone 6 de Marzo of the city El Alto. 
 
Ronald needs this loan in order to pursue a higher education that will help him find better work opportunities and improve his quality of life.
His dream is to establish himself in a career.

This is Ronald's first loan both with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a higher education.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es de la ciudad de Lambaré, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería comercial. Comenta que quienes la inspiran es su familia, sus padres, por el esfuerzo que realizan para salir adelante. El quiere el día de mañana poder ayudarlos e ir creciendo de esa forma.
Además comenta que el estudia y trabaja y que eso lo hace diferente por el esfuerzo que está poniendo por salir adelante. Es un hombre muy trabajador.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad y también para el pago de las cuotas. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo, ya que podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Jose is from the city of Lambaré. He is studying to be a commercial engineer. He says that the people who inspire him are his family, his parents, because of how hard they work to get ahead. He wants to be able to help them in the future and to keep growing in this way. In addition he says that he is studying and he is working and that this differentiates him because of the effort that he is putting into getting ahead. He is a very hard-working man. He is seeking this loan in order to be able to invest it in paying for his university classes and also for paying the fees. He is grateful for this opportunity for advancement that he is receiving, since he will be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for university classes and fees.

loans.name: Ivette

texts.es:
Ivette es soltera  no tiene  hijos, vive en casa de su mamà ubicada en la zona de Villa Yunguyo de la ciudad de El Alto. Acaba de terminar la secundaria, actualmente es alumna de segundo año de la carrera de Trabajo Social de la universidad Publica De El Alto. Para cubrir los gastos universitarios vende dos veces a la semana comida.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de una computadora portátil, la impresora y libros. Realizando sus trabajos con mayor comodidad y rapidez.
El sueño de Ivette es terminar su carrera y hacer diplomados para enriquecer sus conocimientos.
.Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ivette is single. She has no children and lives with her mother in the zone Villa Yunguyo of the city El Alto. Ivette finished high school and currently is a second-year Social Work student at the Public University of El Alto. In order to cover her school expenses, she works selling food twice a week. 

Ivette needs this loan in order to buy a laptop, a printer, and books. These will help her to do her work more quickly and comfortably. Ivette's dream is to finish her studies and graduate, broadening her knowledge.

This is Ivette's first loan through IMPRO as well as with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop, printer, and books for her university studies.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen is 44 years old and married with four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her family live in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for several years, earning about 14,000 KHR per day. 

Khen is a second-cycle client. She has successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children ranging from one to ten years old. She describes herself as jolly. She operates a café where she sells food and beverages. She has been involved in this business for four years and employs three staff members. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase flour, rice, sugar and milk. This is her first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase flour, rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel Angel es un señor de 64 años de edad, esta casado hace 20 años, desde muy joven él se dedica a la agricultura con ayuda de su esposa que también tiene el conocimiento sobre la siembra de papa chiricana, don Miguel siembra esta hortaliza una vez al año ya que el proceso de desarrollo se lleva nueve meses y espera dos meses para darle el debido tratamiento a la tierra y volver a sembrar, de cada planta se extrae un kilo de esta papa la cual vende a los diferentes comerciantes de San Carlos. Desea este crédito para continuar con este proceso ya que en esta época debe cultivar la papa chiricana nuevamente y esto es lo que le permite generar ingresos al hogar ya que en la zona no existen suficientes fuentes de empleo. Eligió Fundación Mujer porque su esposa ya tuvo un crédito con nosotros para la misma actividad y les fue muy bien por las bajas tasas de interés. Don Miguel espera continuar sembrando esta hortaliza ya que esto les permite generar ingresos al hogar y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is 64 years old. He has been married for 20 years. Since he was a young boy, Miguel has made a living in agriculture with the help of his wife, who also is skilled in growing chiricana potatoes. Miguel harvests his crops once a year since the whole process takes nine months, then it is necessary to wait two months to resow his crops in order to treat the soil. From each of his plants, Miguel harvests a kilogram of potatoes, which he sells in San Carlos. 

Miguel is requesting this loan in order to continue with this work. It is time for Miguel to begin a new cycle of chiricana potatoes. This will help him earn money for his family since there is a shortage of employment in his area. Miguel elected to request a loan through Fundación Mujer because his wife has already obtained a loan from them for the same purpose and it was a very successful endeavor for them because of the low interest rates. 

Miguel hopes to continue growing his crops so that he will increase his household income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow chiricana potatoes.

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan, 31 years old, is married and has four kids. She lives with her husband in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living through planting cassava and farming rice. Together, they can earn about 41,000 KHR per day from the current business and manage to save about 22,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Phan has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loans that she successfully paid back have helped her family support their business and improve their living conditions. Now Phan is leading her group to ask for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make rice to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline, es separada y  tiene dos hijos uno asiste al colegio y su otro pequeño tiene apenas 3 años de edad, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Litoral de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la venta de distintas prendas de vestir para niños además ropa y frazadillas para bebé. En su puesto de venta la cual se encuentra en la zona 12 de octubre 
El crédito es para comprar material de construcción (bolas de cemento) ya que realizará el vaciado de pisos.
El sueño de Jaqueline es tener un departamento propio. Ademas de convertirse en distribuidora de ropa infantil.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, is separated from her husband and has two children: one is in high school while the other is 3 years old. They live in her parents' house, located in the zone Litoral of the city El Alto. Jacqueline has a high school education and currently works selling a variety of clothing for children and babies. She works in the zone 12 de octubre.

Jacqueline is requesting this loan in order to buy bags of cement so that she will be able to fill in some holes in her floor. Her dream is to have her own apartment and to become a baby's clothing distributor. 

This is Jacqueline's fourth loan through IMPRO and her first loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement to fill in her floor.

loans.name: Samart

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Batie district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Samart, 39, is a married mother of four children. The source of her family’s income is rice farming. She and her husband have been in this business for 10 years. They complement the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 42,000 KHR per day.
 
This is the second loan for Samart with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she successfully used the first loan to relieve her family’s financial burden and increase their income. With the need to support her business, she is requesting another loan of KHR 4,000,000 with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to buy cows to raise. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Bankan district of Pursat province, Sotheary is a 30-year-old widowed mother of three children. All of the children are still dependent on her and in school. Sotheary is a teacher and she also farms rice to supplement her income. She has been in this business for almost 15 years, earning about 27,000 KHR per day.

Sotheary has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan which has helped her to improve her livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow more healthy crops and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Kgem's Group

texts.en:
Living a wooden house in the Samroung district of Takeo province, Kgem is 63 years old and married with four children. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and weaving mats. Having been in this business for almost forty years, she can earn about 15,000 KHR per day.

This is the sixth loan for Kgem with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans. The other group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Kgem is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine. She hopes that having a clean latrine to use will help her family have good health.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a proper latrine

loans.name: Sayidat Al Khalas Group

texts.en:
Aida is the featured borrower of Sayidat Al Khalas group. She joined her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Aida is a hard-working 62-year-old married woman and the mother of two children who has been working as a tailor for a long time ago in order to help her husband in making their living and covering their family's expenses. Aida is applying for her 50th cycle loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. She is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower, and an excellent borrower who invests every loan she acquires exactly According to her request. 

Through this loan she will improve her business production through buying newly released textile collections for the summer season. Aida is the one sitting in the middle.

Mariam is the one at the right she is also applying for her 50th cycle loan; she is a 58-year-old married woman, mother of one child.

Marcel is the one at the left, she is also applying just like her group members for her 50th loan cycle, she is a 39-year-old married mother of two children.

loans.use: to improve her business production through buying newly released textile collections for the summer season

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Hurelbaatar is 50 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife Adiyajav, is 40 years old and helps her husband run their family business, a grocery store. His son Sengerravdan is a sophomore student and also helps his parents. Hurelbaatar has been running various kinds of businesses for eight years. 

Last year, he opened a small grocery store on their plot of land to serve customers in the neighborhood. He purchases inventory from big markets in bulk and sells in retail in his store. He rents a car to transport the goods and spends a lot of money on that. He is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a natural gas-consuming, eco-friendly car to decrease operational expenses. He is a smart, hardworking, and kind man.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas consuming, eco-friendly car to decrease operational expenses

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 22 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Marneuli district. Gela does not have a source of income at the moment, as he is unemployed. The only income provider in the family is Gela’s wife, who works as an artist locally. 

Gela plans to start up a café. The local credit providers have rejected his loan request because of his low income. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the increased credit, Gela will purchase building materials, all the kitchen appliances, and stocks of products that will be used for starting the café. According to Gela’s estimations, his project will be profitable, and he will attract many customers. As a result of the new business initiative, the income of the family will increase and their living conditions will improve. In addition to the above mentioned, in case of need in the future, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase inventories for starting a cafe

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sokha is 40 years old and married. She has three children. To support the family, she and her husband have been in farming rice, rubber and cassava for 21 years. The current business earns her family about KHR 48,000 per day to meet her family’s needs.

Sokha has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is applying for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy fertilizers for her cassava plants. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her cassava plants

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy de 47 años de edad, con un hijo mayor de edad, es originario de león, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Freddy se caracteriza por ser trabajar, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Desde muy temprana edad ha tenido que trabajar duro para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, por eso lucha día a para tener un futuro mejor.

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de superación personal, tiene por actividad económica la una librería la cual vende productos como libros, cuadernos, lápices, reglas, cartulina, papel bond, carta legal, corrector, borradores. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos escolares para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Freddy agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Freddy, age 47, has an adult son.  He is from León, which is located in the western part of the country.  Freddy is known for being hard-working and responsible with the desire for personal improvement.  Starting at a very early age, he has had to work hard in order to help with the household expenses.  He struggles day to day for a better future.

Thanks to his motivation and desire for personal improvement, he has a business activity, a bookstore.  He sells products like books, notebooks, pencils, rulers, cardboard, bond paper, legal size paper, corrector products, and erasers.  He spends ten hours a day on his business, which he does with great pleasure.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock his business.  He will buy and sell school products so that, in the not so distant future, he will be able to have better income.  Freddy is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy stock for his bookstore.

loans.name: Engracia

texts.es: Engracia, mayor de edad casada con cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, ella se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general como: variedades de ropa, para adultos, niños, damas, los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante y por encargos sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de mayoreos, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos,  eventuales y  por encargos. Engracia inicia su negocio hace seis años atrás al momento de su jubilación y lo toma como otra alternativa de ingresos en su hogar, Este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería como: ropa de niños, caballeros, damas entre otros productos más.-
texts.en:
Engracia, a married woman with three adult children, comes from a municipality in Chinandega, in the western part of the country. She sells merchandise such as clothing for adults, children, and women. She makes her sales as a street vendor and also takes orders. She purchases her goods at wholesale markets in cash, and her sales are in cash or credit for regular and occasional customers as well as for orders. 

Engracia started her business six years ago after she retired, and it is an alternative source of income for her household. This loan will be used as capital for the purchase of merchandise such as clothing for children, men, and women, among other products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as a variety of clothing for children, women, and men, to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles does farming as his major economic activity. He says this has been the source of income for the last 20 years. He lives in Nanyuki. He is blessed with four adult children who do not depend on him anymore. The crops that he deals with are potatoes, onions, cabbages, carrots and many other horticultural crops. These crops he sells at the local market when he harvests. He learned about Milango through an employee who visited him at his home in Nanyuki where his family is. The 56-year-old will use the extra income raised from the loan to buy dairy cattle and start producing milk, if all goes as planned. He now seeks a loan to buy potato seedlings, tomato seedling and cabbages. He wants to better his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, tomato seedling and cabbages.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor is 34 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six children in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. Some of her children are in school while the others are too young for school. She and her husband are rice farmers and her husband is a construction worker to earn more income for the family. Having been in this business for 10 years, together they can earn about KHR 25,000 per day.
 
Hor is a third-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely paid back her prior loans, which has helped her improve her family’s living condition. Now she is requesting a loan of KHR 2,000,000 with VisionFund to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy construction materials for her husband's business. She hopes to grow her business and raise more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Zorigt is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His wife grows organic vegetables on their plot of land, while his older daughter, Suvd-Erdene, is a university student and his two younger daughters, Soyol-Erdene and Oyun-Erdene, are secondary school students. He and his wife are hardworking and diligent people.

Zorigt has been performing carpentry at home since 2000. He built a small workplace on his plot of land, but during winter it is not warm enough so his sales drop to the minimum level. His wife is also planning to plant seabuckthorn trees on their plot of land to produce organic fruit and fruit juice. He is requesting 3,500,000MNT to purchase insulation material for his workplace and seabuckthorn trees to plant.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material for his workplace and seabuckthorn trees to plant.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has 3 children and describes herself as honest. She sells used clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add more bails of clothes. She hopes to open a boutique in the future. This is her 2nd application for a loan from SMEP DTM, with the previous loan being kes 20,000.

loans.use: to add more bails of clothes.

loans.name: Cho's Group

texts.en:
Cho is 42 years old and has three children, one of whom is still in school and dependent on her. She is a villager from a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of the Battambang province in Cambodia. She has generated income for her family by feeding fish for 10 years. 

Cho is a third-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has completely paid back her past loans. The past loans have improved her family with decent food. Now she and her two group members are applying for a new loan from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use the loan to buy fish feed to support her fish. She hopes to increase her income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish feed.

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en:
Sreang is 33 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province's Dambae district. He has grown cashews on a one-hectare farm for 10 years. The current business has provided him with about 22,200 KHR per day. 


He has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles. The past loans have been successfully repaid and have helped him to grow his cashews. Now he is applying for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for his cashew farm. He hopes that he can improve his crop yield to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow cashews.

loans.name: Ephrance

texts.en:
Ephrance is a single mother of two children, one of whom goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brother).  

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income as a teacher at the nearby school.  She works from home and sells charcoal on a retail basis, seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring to see her business grow to the point that she only sells charcoal wholesale. She also aspires to get enough profit to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and no piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Salim's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager in Pursat province, Salim is a farmer who does rice growing on two hectares of farmland in the local area. She has two children, one of them is still in school, while another one is too young for school. From the current business, which she has been with for 20 years, she is able to earn about 15,300 KHR per day. 

Her previous loan with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner) was her third loan. After the successful loan, which she has fully repaid, she feels confident that she can improve her living condition at a good pace. Now she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is seeking 1,300,000 KHR while her member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and plow her farmland for growing rice. She hopes that she can get a high crop yield from her farmland to have a better living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and plow her farmland for growing rice.

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en: Faustine is a 43 year old, married man. He describes himself as ambitious. He is a bike mechanic, a trade which he has been involved in for 10 years. His business is located in a busy marketplace. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate space for expansion. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to constuct a larger space for his business. This is his first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to constuct a larger space for his business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is 33 years old and is a loving mother of two young children. She owns a house in the Kompong Cham province. She has devoted her lifetime to farming and is skilled in managing her two-hectare farmland on which she grows rice. The income generated from her rice farm enables her to cover her living costs and educate her children.

At the moment, she is looking for a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to help her cover the operating costs this planting season. The loan is very important for her to gather more income to improve her living conditions. In the coming years, she hopes to enlarge her farm and earn greater profit from it.

loans.use: to help her cover her rice farm's operating costs this planting season.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
