Donald aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married. and has a tailoring business business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional linen, tailoring chalk, etc to be used in her business.

Susana has been in this business for 22 years.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional linen, tailoring chalk, etc to be used in her business

loans.name: Ansatou Djite's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes  qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente et solidarité les membres. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ansatou (assise droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03  enfants (1 Garçon et 2 filles). C’est une femme qui connait une évolution notable depuis son entrée dans le système des bancs villageois et sa capacité a financé son activité suit une croissance notable. En plus de son activité directe au marché, elle achète du poisson sec dans la côtière du sud du pays par panier.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en poisson sec, en huile de palme et  patte d’arachide.
- Pour poisson sec 04 paniers à 60 000 F Cfa, qu’elle revend au détail au prix variant entre 200 et 1 000 F Cfa.
- Pour l’huile de palme 02 bidons de 20 litres à 30 000 F Cfa revendus par bouteille d’un litre à 1 000 F Cfa et sachet de 100 à 200 F Cfa.
- Pour la patte d’arachide 02 seaux de 20 litres à 26 000 F Cfa revendus par détail en sachet de 100 à 500 F Cfa. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la maison et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very active in the village bank that was created in December 2010. The women who are at the heart of the group all come from the same neighbourhood and they get on well with each other and share a good solidarity. Their main activity is small business.
Mrs. Ansatou (sitting on the right) is the star borrower of the group. She is 35 and is married with three children (one boy and two girls.) This woman has made noteworthy progress since she joined the village bank system and her capacity to finance her business has progressed well. In addition to her activity at the market, she buys dried fish in the coastal area to the south of the country by the basketful.
With this loan she plans to stock up on dried fish, palm oil, and groundnut paste.
For four baskets of dried fish at 60 000 F Cfa, that she resells retail at a price that varies between 200 and 1000 F Cfa
For 2 cans of 20 litres of palm oil at 30 000 F Cfa that she resells in sachets at 100 or 200 FCfa and bottles of one litre for 1'000 FCfa.
For two buckets of 20 litres of groundnut paste at 26 000 F Cfa resold for 100 to 500 F Cfa. per sachet.
The profits from her activity enable her to help her husband to assume the daily management of the household and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to stock up on dried fish, palm oil, and groundnut paste.

loans.name: Sherina

texts.en:
Sherina is married with two children, and only one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used   children’s clothes.  

She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenge include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of importing used clothes and also to buy her own house. The family resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used children's clothes.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 49 years old, and married to Peris; they have five children who are in school. He has a clothing business, which he has operated for the past eight years. 

He earns a monthly income of shs 30,000, and has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy clothing to sell.  He paid his previous loan on time.  He plans to use the anticipated profit to buy an additional stock of clothing.

In the near future, Nicholas hopes to apply for another loan from KADET LTD to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She sells food in her small cafe to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase foodstuffs of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан, 37 лет, замужем, многодетная мама, имеет 4 детей (2сына и 2 дочери). По специальности – медсестра, работает в родильном доме. В поиске дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жылдызкан с 1999 года начала разводить скот и заниматься полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15000 сом(KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 8000 сом(KGS). Супруг-строитель,помогает по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, также есть свое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 бычка и 20 овец, а также имеется 2,40 ГА поливной земли на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Жылдызкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70 000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 бычка и 9 овец. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве и обучение детей.
texts.en: Jyldyzkan is 37 years old, married and has four children (two sons and two daughters).  She is a nurse by profession and works at the birth and delivery center.  In search of an additonal income for her family, Jyldyzkan started to breed livestock and got involved in farming in 1999, having started this business with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS).  The family's monthly profit is 8,000 som (KGS).  Her husband is a construction worker and helps with the household business.  To-date, Jyldyzkan was able to develop her farming business and have her own farm.  Her farm contains two dairy cows, three bulls and twenty sheep, and also has 2.40 hectares of irrigated land, where she annually grows beans.  In order to further grow her farming and animal husbandry business, Jyldyzkan requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy one bull and nine sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities on her farm and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy one bull and nine sheep

loans.name: Maria Belinda

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 54 años y es casada con hijos ya independientes, ella se dedica  a la venta de   artículos de temporada a crédito, según lo que crea conveniente vender y a veces por pedido que ella visita distintos mercados de la zona ofreciendo sus productos,   Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de Mercadería para surtir la variedad de sus productos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es porque la cliente no cuenta con reservas de dinero para estas fechas. La Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son La época de frío es demasiado fuerte por la zona donde vive, y debido a la avanzada edad de la cliente, no puede movilizarse para conseguir la mercadería más barata y esto le perjudica en su negocio y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar edredones, frazadas, por mayor y el deseo de la Sra. Maria es tener una casa propia para poder vivir tranquila, actualmente vive en anticrético.
texts.en:
María, 54, is married with children who are all independent now.  She works selling seasonal goods on credit according to what she deems advisable to sell and sometimes based on prior orders; she visits various markets in the zone to offer her wares.  

This loan is her second sequence in the institution and María will use it to buy merchandise to stock up on a variety of goods.  Her reason for requesting this loan is because she does not have any funds in reserve for this season.

The business challenge María faces is the cold season because it’s very intense where she lives and due to her advanced age she can’t get around to seek out the least expensive goods and this hurts her business.  She will use profits to buy comforters, blankets and other goods that provide warmth.

Her wish is to have a house of her own to live in peace; she currently lives under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you]

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Jazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул, 27 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей (2сына и 1 дочь). Сразу после окончания школы, вышла замуж. С 2007 года занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20000 сом(KGS). Ежемесячный доход ее семьи составляет 8000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, также есть свое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 2 лошади, 20 овец. Семья очень дружная и трудолюбивая. Также имеется 1,60 ГА поливной земли, 2 ГА богара на которой она ежегодно выращивает картофель, и многолетнюю траву, такую как: клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Жазгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для картофеля и на покупку одной коровы. Доходы от кредита Жазгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en: Jazgul is 27 years old, married and has three children (two sons and one daughter).  She got married right after finishing school.  She has been involved in farming since 2007, having started this business with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS).  The family's monthly income is 8,000 som (KGS).  To-date, she was able to develop her farming business and have her own farm.  Her farm contains one dairy cow, one calf, two horses and twenty sheep.  The family is very friendly and hardworking.  They also have 1.60 hectares of irrigated land, and 2 hectares of rainfed land, where she annually grows potatoes and perennial herbs, such as clover.  In order to further grow her farming and animal husbandry business, Jazgul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy fertilizers for potatoes and to buy one cow.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities on her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for potatoes and to buy one cow

loans.name: Altynai

texts.ru: Алтынай, 28 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей (сын и дочь). Образование-среднее. С 2005 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20 000 сом(KGS). На сегодняшний день ежемесячная прибыль Алтынай составляет 5000 сом. Супруг Алтынай помогает ей по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Алтынай, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка. В наличии имеет 0,37 ГА собственной поливной земли, а также арендует 1,5 ГА земельного надела.  Прибыль позволила Алтынай размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынай обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Алтынай  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Altynai is 28 years old, married and has two children (a son and a daughter).  She has a secondary education.  She has been involved in an agricultural business - animal husbandry and farming - since 2005, having started this business with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS). Today, Altynai's monthly profit is 5,000 som.  Altynai's husband helps her with the business.  Thanks to her hard work, today she has a good farm, containing two dairy cows and two bulls.  She also has 0.37 hectares of owned irrigated land and 1.5 hectares of leased land.  The profit allowed Altynai to increase livestock quantities on the farm and thus, improve the family's welfare.  In order to further grow her business, Altynai requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy one dairy cow. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es: Lauro tiene  60 años, es viudo y vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Es un agricultor muy conocido debido a los años que reside en su zona ya que cultiva cacao, café, barbasco, palillo y árboles frutales. Sus terrenos en clima tropical son fácil de mantener, por esta razón el limpia la maleza de entre sus plantaciones y fertiliza sus suelos con abono orgánico el cual compra al por mayor para obtener precios bajos. En más de una ocasión contrata a trabajadores del lugar para que le ayuden a terminar sus labores en menos tiempo y así darle un mantenimiento uniforme a sus terrenos de cultivo. Gracias al dinero que gana puede mantener a sus hijos y solucionar otros gastos de su familia, es un padre muy responsable y siempre quiso que sus hijos estudien, es por ello que siempre los manda al colegio. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva, es por ello que se siente muy agradecido porque el dinero le sirve para cubrir los gastos para seguir cultivando y trabajar sin preocupaciones. En esta ocasión desea 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Lauro is 60 years old, widowed, and lives with his two children in his own home which is made from adobe.  He is a very well-known farmer owing to the number of years he has lived in his area growing cacao, coffee, verbascum, turmeric and fruit trees.  His land benefits from a tropical climate and is easy to maintain.  He removes the weeds from between his plants and fertilizes his soil with organic fertilizer that he buys wholesale in order to achieve low prices.  On more than one occasion, Lauro has hired local workers to help him finish his farming tasks in less time so that he can provide uniform maintenance for his land.  Thanks to the money that he earns, he is able to support his children and cover other family expenses.  Lauro is a very responsible father and always wanted his children to receive an education.  For this reason, he always sends them to school.  

This is Lauro's third loan from Kiva and he feels grateful because the money helps him to cover the costs of growing his crops and he is able to work without any worries.  On this occasion, he is requesting 2,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his cacao and coffee crops

loans.name: Oscar Bernardo

texts.es:
Oscar reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, hace varios años trabajo como empleado de una panadería que vendía sus productos fuera de la ciudad, así es como aprendió a  realizar diferentes tipos de panes, luego de adquirir mucha experiencia  del giro de esta actividad decide poner su propio negocio, donde el mismo realiza todo el proceso de Compra de materia prima, producción y venta al consumidor final. 

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a podido   tener una gran cantidad de clientes que están contentos con los productos que se ofrecen en su local, es por eso que decidió realiza un préstamo en Banco D-MIRO porque ahora tiene como objetivo alquilar un local en una de las calles principales de la ciudad, para ofrecer productos   de buena calidad  comprando materia prima de calidad.
texts.en:
Oscar lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador.  He worked several years as a bakery employee and was responsible for selling its products outside of the city.  As a result, he learned how to make different types of bread.  With the great amount of experience he acquired, he decided to start his own business, where he is in charge of the entire process – buying the raw materials, making the product, and selling it to the end consumer.  Through great effort and dedication, he has been able to acquire a large number of customers and keep them happy with the products he offers from his shop.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Banco D-MIRO because he now plans to rent another shop along one of the main streets of the city.  In order to offer high quality products, he will buy supplies that are also of good quality.

loans.use: to rent a shop

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 42 años de edad, pero tiene la alegría y el carisma de una joven de 20 años, Dolores vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad en la cual se encuentran paisajes hermosos, tiene una gastronomía muy variada, siendo uno de sus platillos más conocidos el riquísimo “Chupe de Camarones”. Dolores se madre de 2 hijos de 14 y 19 años, a quienes ama muchísimo y por quienes trabaja muy duro y se esfuerza para poder brindarles una vida digna y poder sacarlos adelante, ya que es madre soltera.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Dolores logro iniciar su negocio de venta de anticuchos, desde hace algunos meses, con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, dolores trabaja alrededor de 5 horas, ya que mayormente ofrece sus productos en la noche; dolores cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muy buena sazón.

Dolores está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda y mejorar su negocio , ya que comprar una rejilla nueva para poder freír sus anticuchos, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder seguir mejorando su negocio, de esta manera ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y tener un restaurante.”
texts.en:
Dolores is 42-years-old but has the joy and charisma of a 20-year-old.  Dolores lives in the city of Camaná, city with beautiful scenery and a very diverse cuisine.  One of its most famous dishes is the delicious “Chupe de Camarones” [Shrimp Chowder].  Dolores is the mother of two children who are 14 and 19 years of age who she loves very much and for whom she works hard and strives to provide them with a proper life and to be able to raise them since she’s a single mother.

With much effort and savings, Dolores managed to start her business selling ‘anticuchos’ [grilled meat kebabs] a few months ago.  With the fruits of her labor she’s able to cover her household expenses.  Dolores works about 5 hours because she mostly works at night.  She believes she’s getting ahead because she’s very kind to customers and above all because she’s a very tasty cook.

Dolores is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve provided she will be able to do some home and some business improvements.  She will buy a new grill to grill the anticuchos thus improving her family’s quality of life and be able to stay in business.  She will continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to provide her children with professions and to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to do some home improvements and to buy a grill.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in New Kru town. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children between 26 and 16. Only two of her children are in school and live at home. Monica completed seventh grade, so she decided to keep herself busy with business by selling foodstuffs like milk, sugar, eggs, bread, etc. to improve her life. 

She started this business with a little money from her husband two years ago. She says fewer goods on her table are the only challenge she faces now. She likes her business because is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She said, "I am proud of my business because is the only means I can help children." With the loan she is going to buy more milk, sugar, eggs, bread, etc. to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more milk, sugar, eggs, bread, etc to resell.

loans.name: Juan Hipolito

texts.es:
Juan vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica; Perú; tiene 21 años de edad y debido a sus pocos recursos económicos estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración, como buen peruano a Juan le gusta mucho la comida típica, por ello uno de los platos que más le gusta es el pollo al horno. Y en sus tiempos libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos del barrio.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación dia  dia sale a trabajar ofreciendo sus servicios como chofer de taxi, el alquila un vehículo y transita por las calles de la ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, con lo cual puede tener ingresos que le ayuda a apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; Juan cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y amable con los clientes.

Juan esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina nueva para su madre, ya que actualmente tiene una cocina a kerosene, la cual es peligrosa cuando se usa, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una empresa de taxis y seguir apoyando a su familia”.
texts.en:
Juan, 21, lives in the Parcona district of Ica, Peru.  He studied through the fifth year of secondary school because he has limited economic resources, but he would like to have studied business administration.  As a good Peruvian Juan loves traditional Peruvian food; one of the dishes he likes best is baked chicken.  In his spare time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends.

With a lot of effort and dedication he goes out to work every day offering his services as a taxi driver.  He rents a vehicle and goes around the city streets looking for passengers, which can give him income to help his parents with the household expenses.  Juan believes he's getting ahead because he's responsible and friendly with the customers.

Juan's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help he'll be able to buy a new stove for his mother.  Currently she has a kerosene stove, which is dangerous when used.

This way he'll be able to improve his family's quality of life and continue striving to achieve his big dream: "To have a taxi company and continue supporting his family."

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres,  son mujeres trabajadoras  que están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y tienen todo el entusiasmo de ir creciendo en lo que cada una está haciendo. Ellas son de la cuidad de Curuguaty, una zona muy alejada, bastante rural, que esta aun en desarrollo.
La Sra. Antonia es una persona muy trabajadora, y emprendedora, lucha día a día para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Antonia está trabajando en la costura, también hace prendas de todo tipo y son de muy buena calidad. Sueña con algún día tener un buen taller de costuras bien equipado con varias maquinas, también nos dice que quiere que su comunidad siga creciendo y mejorando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones, cierres y demás, ya que con ello podrá seguir haciendo sus costuras y dando a sus clientes un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program.  These industrious women are learning how to work together.  All of them are very excited about growing each of their businesses.  They are from the city of Curuguaty, which is in a remote rural district that is still under development.

Sra. Antonia is a hardworking and enterprising person.  She strives each day to provide her family with everything they need so that they don’t have to experience being without like she had to endure.  Antonia is a seamstress, but she also makes all types of jewelry that are of very good quality.  She dreams of someday having a successful workshop that is well-equipped with various machines.  Antonia says that she wants her community to keep growing and improving.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in fabrics, thread, rubber, buttons, zippers, and other items.  This will enable her to continue sewing so that she can do good work for her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, rubber, buttons, zippers, and other items

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 50 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia y junto su esposo y un hijo. Sonia se dedica a la elaboración de panes, para ello cuenta con un espacio en su casa donde tiene un horno artesanal. Diariamente entrega sus productos a los varios tiendas en su mototaxi. Lleva en esta actividad 6 años y en todo este tiempo ha logrado consolidar una buena clientela. Trabaja con el apoyo de su familia. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la sensación que siente al saber que está tras el logro de sus objetivos y más adelante desea establecer una tienda de productos comestibles, mientras tanto continúa cumpliendo su labor actual con mucho entusiasmo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con el préstamo solicitado comprará insumos para sus panes principalmente harina por sacos y mantequilla.
texts.en:
Sonia is 50, married, and lives in her own house with her husband and son. Sonia makes bread. For this she has a space in your house where she has an artisanal oven. Every day, she delivers her products to various stores in her moto-taxi. She has been in this business for six years, and in all this time has managed to build up a good clientele. She works with the support of her family. 

What she likes about her work is how it makes her feel, knowing that she is on the way to achieving her goals. Someday she wishes to establish a store selling food products. In the meantime she continues to carry out her current work with a great deal of enthusiasm. 

On this occasion she will apply for 1200 soles. She is very happy to know that she will have financial assistance, as this way she will feel sure of advancing with her business. Moreover, she promises once more to make her installment payments on time. With the loan applied for she will buy ingredients for her bread, mainly flour by the sack and butter.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her bread-making business, such as flour and butter.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Ángel tiene 35 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 8, 5 y 3 años,  el se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de San Matías,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Ángel va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para siembra de papa  y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Ángel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindad, una vez que cosecha sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la comunidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Ángel is 35 and the father of three children aged 8, 5, and 3. He grows potatoes, yucca, corn, and a variety of other vegetables on his plot in the town of San Matías. 

This is Ángel's first loan from the institution. He will use the loan funds to purchase seed potatoes for planting, which requires preparing the soil. This loan will also help Ángel meet household expenses and improve his family's quality of life in the face of challenges such as poor weather that has often wiped out plantings. Ángel is very dependable and hard-working; he is also solely responsible for all household expenses. Ángel is also grateful for the lender's support. After harvesting his crops, he sells them directly to consumers in community markets.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años siembra maíz y frijol tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y los vende a precios accesibles, la clienta es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar con su hijo de tres años de edad, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc. para poder seguir con sus siembras y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo  lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The customer her been making her living in agriculture for four years and she sows corn and beans. She has a lot of customers because her products are of an excellent quality and she sells them at accessible prices. The customer is a single mother who lives in a relative's home with her three-year-old son. 

She is seeking a loan to buy manure, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and so on to continue sowing her crops and therein gain better profits to give to her son what he needs with no limits.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and so on.

loans.name: Dúo Avalos Group

texts.es:
DUO  AVALOS 

LA SEÑORA DEYCI DE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A SALON Y ESTETICA DE BELLLEZA ELLA  ES MADRE DE DOS HIJOS DURANTE DOS AÑOS ELLA SE PREPARO COMO CULTORA DE BELLEZA EMPRENDIO SU NEGOCIO HACE APROXIMADAMNTE 8 AÑOS NUNCA PENSO QUE SU NEGOCIO IBA A LLEGAR A SER TAN GRANDE POR LO QUE ESTA AGRADECIDA CON DIOS POR LAS FUERZAS Y LA PROVICION QUE LE DA DIA CON DIA Y ES POR ESO QUE ELLA TOCA LAS PUERTAS DE FAPE PARA SOLICITAR UN CREDITO YA QUE POR LA DEMANDA QUE ELLA TIENE EN SU NEGOCIO NO ALCANZA SATISFACER A SUS CLIENTES, ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE COSMETICOS Y UTENCILIOS PARA SALON DE BELLEZA.
texts.en:
Avalos Duo

Deyci, 29, owns a beauty salon and spa.  She’s the mother of two children.  She took beauty courses for two years to become a stylist and started her business about 8 years ago.  She never thought her business would become so big and she’s grateful to God for the strength and support He gives her daily.

This is why she came knocking at FAPE’s door to request a loan because demand for her business is so large that she’s unable to meet customers’ needs.  She’s asking for this loan to buy cosmetics and utensils for her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el tiene un negocio de venta de tortas en su lugar de residencia es un hombre responsable, trabajador y honesto, tiene mucha clientela pues sus alimentos son muy buenos y a precios accesibles con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas  logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar sus alimentos salsa de tomate, mayonesa, tomates, cebollas, pan, etc. para seguir con su negocio y poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The client lives in his own house with his wife and child.

He has a business selling sandwiches in his house.  He's a responsible, hardworking, and honest man.  He has a lot of customers because his dishes are very good and affordable.  With his profits he's able to cover some of the household expenses.

The client's requesting a loan to be able to buy all the ingredients he needs to make his dishes: tomato sauce, mayonnaise, tomatoes, onion, bread, etc.  He'll be able to continue with his business and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 2 años vende en su vehículo por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su familia, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que es el que le sirve para poder trasladarse por las colonias para vender su mercadería, para poder obtener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The client is a very hard-working, honest, and responsible person. He has sold fruits and vegetables in the various neighbourhoods around his home from his vehicle for two years. He lives in his own home with his family. With his income, he helps with his family's costs. He is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of more merchandise, and to maintain his vehicle because he needs it to get back and forth to sell his merchandise. This loan will help him make a better income and continue to help his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale and to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 20 años de edad, se dedica al cultivo de maíz para sostener los ingresos en el hogar, este trabajo lo aprendió desde pequeño, con sus padres, tiene 10 años de trabajar en los propio, en un horario de lunes a sábado de 6:00am a 12:00md.
Actualmente iniciara el cultivo, para esto solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, foliares, para comenzar el trabajo agrícola. Esta inversión le ayudara a tener una mejor producción y uno de sus riesgos es que el invierno  sea muy lluvioso o muy seco, eso afectaría la producción.
Su sueño es mejorar su economía y financiarles el estudio a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old. He lives with his family. He has two children ages 18 and 20. José makes a living growing corn to provide for his family. He learned to grow corn when he was a young boy from his parents. He has been working on his own for the last ten years. José works from Monday to Saturday from 6 a.m. to 12 p.m. Currently, it is time for another round of planting. 

José is requesting this loan in order to buy compost, weed killer, and plant fertilizer to begin his work. This investment will help him yield a better production. Some of the risks for his crops are too much rain or drought because of the winter season. José's dream is to improve his financial situation and provide his children with a good education so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy compost, weed killer, and plant fertilizer.

loans.name: Nenomenawo

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des machines pour coudre les habits des clients, Nenomenawo couturière de profession sollicite de WAGES  son premier crédit. Agée de 62ans, elle est mariée et mère de famille. comme perspectives d’avenir, elle espère améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille et agrandir son activité. Elle a 12 apprentis en charge.
texts.en: In order to buy sewing machines to sew clothes for her clients, Nenomenawo, a trained seamstress, is asking WAGES for her first loan. Aged 62, she is married and the mother of a family. For the future, she hopes to improve the standard of living of the family and expand her business. She has 12 apprentices working with her.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old, married, and has six children who attend school. He has a motorbike repair business in Nyahururu, which he has been doing for  three years. 

Daniel is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy spare parts for his business. With anticipated profit, he hopes to add more spare parts to his business and pay school fees. In the future, he hopes to see his business grow and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Rosa Liliam

texts.es:
Lilian tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo. Desde hace 8 años  se dedica a la agricultura trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, antes se dedicaba a estudiar. Ellos toda la vida se han dedicado a esta actividad productiva. 

Para comprar los insumos, viaja en un vehículo hasta  la ciudad que esta  a una distancia de 14 kilómetros de su casa. 

    El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar hierro y lamina para cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que esta deteriorado. Así tendrá una vivienda mas digna para su familia  para la cual ella trabaja y no tener problema con las lluvias. Gracias al crédito podrá tener mejor producción en su cosecha y su familia podrá estar mas tranquila con una vivienda mejor y mayor producción en sus cultivos
texts.en:
Lilian, 27, is a single mother of one son.  For the last 8 years she’s worked in agriculture having learned from her parents; she used to be a student.  They have spent their entire lives in this productive activity.  To buy supplies she travels by vehicle to a city that’s 14 kilometers from home.

The loan she’s requesting is to purchase iron beams and tin roofing to replace her deteriorating roof.  In this way she’ll have a more dignified home for her family that works well with well and will have no problems with the rain.  Thanks to the loan she’ll be able to have better crop production and her family can be more at peace with a better dwelling and higher crop production.

loans.use: to purchase iron beams and tin roofing to replace her deteriorating roof

loans.name: Elvinah

texts.en:
Elvinah is a 33-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail store. She has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a shopping centre. 

Elvinah describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ishaka Iii Group

texts.fr:
Bernard fait partie du groupe  Ishaka III et habite à  Ngozi. Il  a 42 ans et est marié à  Jacqueline, un cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants,  âgés de 7 mois  à 17 ans, dont 4 étudient.
  
Il fait le commerce de haricot et de sorgho depuis 26  ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot et de sorgho à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrai acheter une moto et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Bernard is part of the group called Ishaka III and lives in Ngozi. He is 42 and married to Jacqueline, a farmer. Together they have seven children, ranging from 7 months to 17 years old. Four among them are enrolled in school. 
  
Bernard has been selling beans and sorghum for 26 years.  

He is on his second loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he is going to grow his working capital and buy a large quantity of dried beans and sorghum for resale so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy a motorcycle and see his children attend higher education.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of dried beans and sorghum for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She has been involved in this business for four years and employs two staff members. Her business is located in a rural area. 

Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of seeds to plant. This is her first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her  stock of seeds to plant.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Zona 4 Group

texts.es:
La señora Eva es madre soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la compra y venta de guipiles típicos, inició este negocio trabajando con sus familiares y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando mercadería variada ya que ahora no tiene surtido su negocio, espera en el futuro tener un local donde pueda vender y distribuir a otros municipios. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de ropa típica, actividades pecuarias y confeccion de blusas.
texts.en:
Eva is 19 years old and a single mother. She did not have the opportunity to study. She works buying and selling traditional huipils [a traditional garment made from woven and embroidered fabric varying in length from blouse to dress]. She began this business working with family members, and now she has eight years of experience in it. 

Eva is the organizer of this group. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital to buy various merchandise, as at the moment her business is not well stocked. She hopes in the future to have a store from which to sell and distribute to other municipalities.

The other members of the group work at selling traditional clothing, raising and selling livestock and making blouses.

loans.use: to buy traditional huipils to offer for sale.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from prepaid mobile loading.  Estelita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, soy sauce, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to build her business.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, soy sauce, noodles, etc

loans.name: María Emilce

texts.es: María Emilce, tiene la edad  de 58 años, está casada, vive con su  esposo  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca con una cría al destete y también se encuentra preñada. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener algo de leche para su familia y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María Emilce is 58 years old, is married and lives with her husband, who is her highest priority. With her loan she intends to purchase a pregnant cow with a weaning calf. The idea is to take advantage of the grassy space that she has, the good conditions of the land, and the climate in order to have these animals. She will also get some milk for her family and raise calves to sell as meat in the future. 

With this purchase she will be able to develop another business, and also to have a savings that will allow her to have more animals and invest more in the property. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had any other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided her the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Rosela has been in this business for five years. Rosela earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Rosela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es:
Vilma, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para cubrir los eventos al municipio; este le permitirá comprar bebidas tales como: refrescos, sodas, pollo, carnes, verduras, entre otros para la elaboracion de comida.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue de mucho ayuda, ya que le permitió mejorar la vivienda porque antes era de adobe y hoy en día es de bloque;  las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Vilma is seeking a new loan as she needs more working capital to cater for events in the town; it will enable her to buy drinks such as: soft drinks, fizzy drinks, chicken, meat and vegetables, among other things needed for preparing food.  Her previous loan was very helpful in enabling her to improve her home which, originally made of adobe, is now made from breezeblocks.  Her financial situation and family circumstances have also improved tremendously.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fizzy drinks, chicken, meat and vegetables, among other things

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and blessed with one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites food leftovers leading to losses, hence that is her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, aged 31 years, is a married woman and she lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school for the kids.

She has operated a fish selling business for the past one year. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the loan of Kshs 10,000, she is requesting, she wants to purchase fish for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Wilber Josué

texts.es:
Wilber tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero. Nació en una zona rural a las faldas del volcán, sus padres se dedicaban a actividades agrícolas de siembra de maíz y frijol. fue así como aprendió a realizar trabajos de producción agrícola y cuando tenia 12 años de edad de sus ahorros se compro un ternero que en ese tiempo le costo $11.42 que parecía que se le iba a morir estaba pequeño y flaco pero lo cuido, lo alimento con los residuos de las cosechas y se desarrollo. lo vendió en un precio de $150.00 y de ese dinero compro dos novillos, ya mas grandes y desde ese tiempo se dedica a cuidar los novillos y  los amansaba para tirar la carreta y arado, al cabo de una temporada de un año los vendía a mayor precio ya mas grandes y mansos para hacer trabajos de tiro y luego compra otros y los amansa con un hermano mayor.   

 los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en la ciudad, bajan de las faldas del volcán  en autobús o pick up a unos 10 kilómetros luego los acarrean en la espalda cuando es poco pero cuando es bastante los trasladan con los bueyes no se pueden cargar mucho, porque desde la parada del bus hay que  subir una cuesta como de 1 kilómetro hasta el sitio del cultivo.     

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos novillos y algunos insumos para sembrar en el mes de agosto 1.4 hectáreas de maíz y 0.7 hectáreas de frijol rojo de seda en el mes de septiembre. La idea de comprar  los animales es para lograr los pastos que crecen de forma natural en la parte alta del volcán en la época de lluvias que es un terreno que antiguamente era una finca y ahora prácticamente es del estado.   La  yunta de novillos pequeños  se alimenten del pasto natural hasta que se crezcan un poco luego en la época de verano que no hay pasto los se alimentan con los residuos de la cosecha de maíz y frijol y se amansan para trabajar con la carreta y la de poder comprar los insumos necesarios para realizar los cultivos hoy este año sembraran 0.7 hectáreas mas de cultivo de maíz.
 

La idea de trabajar un poco mas es porque quiere mejorar la casa ahora es de bahareque con su techo de lamina y algún día espera  construirla de ladrillos o bloques, junto con sus hermanos  y es un sueño que desean  lograr por que en realidad están solos en esto su mama se separo de su papa hace algunos años y luego su padre se acompaño de nuevo con otra mujer. Pero eso ya paso comenta Wilber, le agradece  a su mama que le dio la vida y a su padre que le enseño a trabajar.
texts.en:
Wilber is 21 and single.  He was born in a rural area in the foothills of the volcano.  His parents grew corn and beans and that is how he learned how to grow crops.  When he was 12, he used $11.42 of his savings to buy a calf which appeared to be on the verge of death.  It was small and skinny but he took care of it and fed it with the leftovers from crop harvests and it grew.  He sold it for $150 and used the money to buy two bigger bullocks.  Since then he has devoted himself to breeding bullocks and taming them so that they pull carts and ploughs.  After a year, he sells them (now bigger and tame enough to do heavy pulling work) for a higher price, and then buys some more and tames them, with the help of his older brother.  He obtains his agricultural supplies in the city, transporting them down the 10 kilometers from the foothills of the volcano by bus or van.  Then, if he does not have too many of them, he carries them on his back but, when he has more, he uses oxen to transport them. They cannot carry very much, but his plot of land is one kilometer away from the bus stop, at the top of a slope.  

He will use the loan he is seeking from Fundación Campo to buy two bullocks and some supplies  to sow 1.4 hectares of corn in August and 0.7 hectares of red beans in September.  He wants to buy the bullocks to graze the pasture which grows naturally in the rainy season on the upper slopes of the volcano.  This land was previously a farm and now is practically state property. The team of young bullocks feed on the natural pasture until they grow a little and then, in the summer when there is no pasture, they feed on leftovers from the corn and bean harvest and are tamed so they can pull the cart.  He wants to be able to buy the necessary supplies to grow his crops; this year they will sow a further 0.07 hectares of corn.  
 
The idea of working a bit more is because he wants to improve his home, which is currently made of wattle and daub with a corrugated iron roof, and one day, build it with bricks and blocks. He and his brothers share this dream because they are alone, as their mother separated from their father some years ago and then their father found a new partner.  But, as Wilber says, that is all now in the past and he thanks his mother for giving birth to him and his father for teaching him his trade.

loans.use: to buy two bullocks and some supplies to sow 1.4 hectares of corn in August and 0.7 hectares of red beans in September.

loans.name: Delmi Azucena

texts.es: Delmi, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. El negocio que inicio hace 7 años lo tiene ubicado en un local del mercado de la comunidad donde vende ropa como blusas, camisetas, pantalones, sandalias y otra mercadería. Ella ha obtenido varios préstamos para mantener activo su negocio. Actualmente ha solicitado el catorceavo préstamo y es por 10,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa, sandalias y zapatos para vender. Su plan es seguir trabajando para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Delmi, 36, is a single mother; she has three children living with her in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.  The business she started 7 years ago is located in the community’s market; she sells clothes like blouses, t-shirts, pants, sandals and other merchandise there.  She’s gotten several loans to keep her business in operation.  Currently she’s requesting her 14th loan for 10,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy clothes, sandals and shoes to sell.  Her plan is to continue working to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy clothes like blouses, sandals and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La señora Sabina, habitante de un barrio marginal de Managua, con su familia busca como progresar en la vida, sus hijos hoy en día continúan preparándose, ellos trabajan y estudian para apoyar a su madre al igual que su esposo. Sabina continua con la construcción de cuartos que ha empezado hace bastante, el cual no ha podido terminar por su bajo ingresos económicos como docente de un colegio. Hasta el momento ha podido levantar paredes teniendo pendientes poner el techo, el piso, las ventanas y repellar las paredes con este crédito tiene la esperanza de poder culminar esta obra que le permitirá mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Sabina lives with her family in one of Managua’s marginal neighborhoods.  She’s seeking ways to make progress in life.    Her children are continuing to prepare themselves at present; they work and study in order to help out their mother as does her husband too.

Sabina continues building rooms that she started some time ago but has been unable to complete because of her low school teacher’s salary.  To date, she’s been able to erect the walls but still needs to do the roof, floor, windows and to plaster the walls.  She hopes with this loan to be able to finish the project which will provide more security and comfort for her family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Get Started Initiative Group

texts.en:
Abisagi, a member of the Get Started Initiative Group, was attracted to the group because they help one another start an income generating activity instead of sitting idly. Together with her husband, Abisagi operates a beauty salon which they started to help them have an income generating activity to meet the needs of their family.

They have been building a house which needs more materials for completion to accommodate themselves and the children. Therefore, they opted for a loan which they will pay using the income from the salon. Abisagi is a hardworking woman and thanks the group members for being supportive, and she also thanks the Kiva lenders through Ugafode for partnering with them.

loans.use: To buy building materials for completing the house.

loans.name: Kokor

texts.en:
Kokor lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult, due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms,  filthy conditions,  and over-population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options for transportation, the community contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and food is cheaper.
    
Kokor is single and has two children, ages one and four years. Only one of her children is currently attending school, and they live at home. Kokor was able to complete 11th grade, before starting her business. For the past five years, she has been busy running her cook shop, where she sells rice, soup, and drinks. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more foods to cook for her customers, including rice, dried fish, dried meats, pepper, oil, and onions, plus charcoal for cooking. 

Kokor said, "Besides fewer goods in stock, I have no other problems for now." She managed to establish her cook shop with a little money from her mother. She learned to run the business by seeing other businesswomen. She said, "I enjoy the flows of customers and the fast buying."  Her dreams are to move from her cook shop business to a restaurant business, and to live a better life in future.

loans.use: to buy more foods to cook for her customers, including rice, dried fish, dried meats, oil and onions, plus charcoal for cooking

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es: Lesly tiene 31 años, está casada y vive en la casa de sus suegros junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Lesly se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi, tiene un vehículo de seguna mano que compró hace 1 año el cual lo alquila diariamente a un familiar a cambio de recibir un pago fijo establecido como requisito. Eventualmente se dedica a la venta de verduras en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad con ayuda de su madre. Todo lo que realiza le gusta mucho y no duda en poner su mayor esfuerzo para trabajar cada día con mucho optimismo, su gran deseo ahora es comprar otro mototaxi para alquilarlo y complementar así su principal fuente de ingresos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y algunos repuestos para refaccionar su vehículo de trabajo.
texts.en:
She likes everything she does very much and doesn’t hesitate to put in her best effort to work enthusiastically every day.  Her great wish for now is to buy another mototaxi to least out thus adding to her main source of income.

On this occasion she will request 1,500 soles.  She’s very grateful and happy to know that she can continue to rely on financial support she needs to make progress in her business.  She will use the amount requested to buy tires and some spare parts to repair her work vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires and some spare parts for her work vehicle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of criminal activity, few bathrooms, filthy conditions and over population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options for traveling, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia and food costs less.    

Mary is a widow and has seven children who are between 30 and 18 years old. Only one of her children is currently attending school and two of them still live at home. Mary was unfortunate and could not attend school, but she is good at managing her business. For the past eight years she has been busy running her table business where she sells rice, oil, pepper, etc. With the loan proceeds she will buy more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

She said that having fewer goods is the problem she faces now. With a little money from her mother she managed to establish this business, and learned by watching other businesswomen. She said that she enjoys the flow of customers and the fast buying. Her dreams are to move from a cook shop business to a steady restaurant business and to live a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a farmer in the village of Solo Korein.  He is 59 years old and married with 12 children.  He is a first year farmer with myAgro, and he plants millet.  Moussa would like to take a loan for a semoir, which is a local seeding machine that has 2 boxes: one for seed and one for fertilizer.  The semoir is attached to a cow that will pull the semoir along the field, and there are diggers and a pipe behind each box that will place the correct amount of seed and fertilizer the correct distance apart. This enables farmers to plant using the micro-dosing method of planting – using a small amount of fertilizer per plant instead of the traditional method of broadcasting fertilizer.  This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Moussa will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income.  

Together with myAgro's high-quality inputs and regular trainings, he is confident that he will have a plentiful harvest.  Before Moussa planted manually, which was time-consuming and difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Moussa’s goals are to feed his family, send his children to school, and fix his house with the extra revenue.  Moussa says myAgro helps him reach his goals by providing informative trainings on a regular basis.  He will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income.  All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.use: To pay for a semoir

loans.name: Sotto's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes  qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente et solidarité les membres. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Sotto  (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07enfants  (04 garçons et 03 filles).
Malgré son âge avancé, elle tient une table au marché central où elle vend des légumes frais. Cette activité elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années. Elle se procure les légumes auprès des femmes détentrices de jardins maraîchers par seaux pour la revente par tas ou à la pièce.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en caisse de tomate fraiche à 8 000 F CFA la caisse et divers autres légumes afin de mieux faire tourner son activité. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari à la retraite dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very active in the Banc Villageois, created in December 2010.  All the women of this group come from the same neighborhood. They get along well with one another and are united by strong solidarity ties.  Their main activity is small retail business.

Sotto (seated at the far right and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower.  She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of seven children (four boys and three girls).

In spite of her age, she has a booth at the central market and she sells fresh vegetables.  She has been involved in this activity for several years.  She buys vegetables by the bucket from women who have their own gardens and she resells her produce on a retail basis, selling vegetables by the heap or separately.

She plans to use her loan to buy crates of fresh tomatoes (each crate costing 8,000 CFA francs) as well as various other vegetables, in order to increase her turnover.

The profits from her business will allow her to help her husband, who is retired, to take care of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy crates of fresh tomatoes and various other vegetables.

loans.name: Mantillitas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario  MANTILLITAS está  compuesto por cuatro integrantes tres mujeres y un varón, el coordinador  del  grupo es  el Sr. Jose tiene 29 años, el  se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años el confecciona mochilas y bolsones,  su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona de la Bautista,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Jose va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de sus mochilas por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que el entrega el producto terminado a distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y de la Paz,  el Sr. Jose enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes , el Sr. Jose es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The “Mantillitas” communal bank consists of four members, three women and one man.  The group coordinator is José, 29.  He works making articles of clothing and for the last few years has been making backpacks and tote bags.  His workshop is located at home which is in the Bautista neighborhood.  

This loan is his first sequence in the institution and José will use the loan to buy fabric to make the backpacks at wholesale.  His reason for requesting this loan is to increase investment capital because he delivers his finished products to various street markets in the cities of El Alto and La Paz.

The business challenge José faces is to increase income and he will be using profits to buy sewing supplies to make good quality clothes in order to secure more customer orders. José is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make backpacks.

loans.name: Kiadiatu

texts.en:
Kiadiatu lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of criminal activity, few bathrooms, filthy conditions and over population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are bit cheaper, there are options for traveling, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia and food costs less.   
 
47-year-old Kaidiatu is married. Her husband works as driver, and together they have four children between the ages of 21 and 4. Only three of her children are currently attending school and live at home. Kaidiatu was unfortunate and could not attend school, but she keeps busy running her business where she sells charcoal in the market of New Kru Town. 

With the loan proceeds she will buy more pepper, oil, beans, peanuts, etc. for her business. She said that besides fewer goods on her market table, she has no other problems for now. With a little money from her mother she managed to establish this business fifteen years ago, and learned by seeing other businesswomen. She stated that she enjoys the flow of customers and the fast buying. Her dreams are to move from her charcoal business to a store business, and for her family to live better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, beans, peanuts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Membre très actif du banc villageois, madame Fatoumata est très expérimentée dans le commerce de tissus. Mariée et mère de 07 enfants  dont 04 garçons et 03 filles. Elle achète les tissus par lot et douzaine suivant la saison auprès de grossiste dans la capitale  pour la revente par 6 yards ou par coupon de 4 yards  moyennant 800 F CFA le yard. La vente ce fait dans la plus part du temps à crédit en deux échéances égales.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des tissus d’été autour de 10 coupons  pour la totalité de son prêt.


Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de terminer l’acquisition d’un terrain et la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A very active member of the Banc Villageois, Fatoumata is also a very experienced fabric seller.  She is married and the mother of seven children (four boys and three girls).  

Depending on the season, she buys fabrics in bulk quantities and by the dozen from wholesalers in the capital.  She resells on a retail basis, selling pieces of fabrics measuring 6 or 4 yards and charging 800 CFA francs per yard.  Most of the time, she sells on credit, with two equal repayments.

She plans to use the totality of her loan to buy about ten pieces of summer fabrics.

The profits from her business will allow her to finish buying a plot of land and to take care of her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy about ten pieces of summer fabrics.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Soudeur de profession et cela depuis 1996, Amévi voudrait acheter des matières premières pour répondre aux besoins des clients c’est dans lignée qu’il sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour s’en procurer. Avec 06 apprentis en charge, il espère ouvrir un autre atelier et assurer une bonne condition de vie à la famille (il est marié et père de 04 enfants dont 02 scolarisés). Amévi même est âgé de 38ans.
texts.en:
A professional welder since 1996, Amévi would like to buy some basic supplies to meet his customers' needs.  This is the reason why he is requesting a second loan from WAGES.

With six apprentices currently under his care,  Amévi hopes to open another shop and to provide good living conditions to his family.   

Amévi is married and the father of four children, two of whom are in school.   Amévi himself is 38 years old.

loans.use: to buy work equipment (for welding).

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a single mother of two children, and only one of them goes to school. She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for five years. She generates additional income through teaching. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. She works from home seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Prossy is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma operates a food business, selling dumplings from home to local neighbors. She faces the major challenge of delayed payments. She dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanaamina

texts.en:
Mwanaamina is a 53-year-old married woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight months, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbors. She faces the major challenge of theft. She dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo por que requiere de más capital de trabajo por la temporada; este le permitirá comprar variedad de mercadería tales como: blusas, pantalones, vestidos para niñas.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a cubrir la demanda de los clientes; los ingresos han mejorado, ya que obtiene mayor solvencia económica en la familia.
texts.en:
María needs to take out a new loan because she needs more working capital for the season.  This will make it possible for her to buy a variety of merchandise like blouses, pants and girls’ dresses.

Her previous loan’s effect was that it helped her meet customer demand; her income has improved and she gets better family economic solvency.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants and girls' dresses.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.ru: Татьяна, 41 год, 3 детей (1 дочь, 2 сына). Разведением скота начала заниматься 8 лет назад, с 2005 года, начав с 5000 сом(KGS), на сегодняшний день благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10000 сом(KGS). В своем хозяйстве имеет: 2 коровы, 6 телят и 2 бычка, дополнительно занимается полеводством, имеет земельный надел 2 ГА, где посажен клевер. Татьяна хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота и заниматься полеводством, в связи с этим обратилась к нам в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Татьяна хочет направить на приумножение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Tatiana is 41 years old and has three children (one daughter and two sons).  She got involved in breeding livestock eight years ago in 2005, having started this business with 5,000 som (KGS).  Today, thanks to her persistence and drive, she earns a monthly profit in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS).  She has two cows, six calves and two bulls on her farm, and is additionally involved in farming and has a 2 hectare land plot, where clover is planted.  Tatiana wants to continue increasing livestock headcount and be involved in farming, and requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy livestock.  She plans to use the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Skim through Luis’ Facebook page and you’ll find photos highlighting his style as a caterer in which guests flock to events to enjoy his homemade Mexican dishes. Through his business, Taquizas Los Pistoleros, Luis  offers carne asada (grilled beef), tripas (beef intestines), al pastor (pork), menudazo (soup), aguas frescas (fruit drinks), salsas (sauces), and tamales, all served with your choice of a side of  rice or baked potato and a variety of drinks ready for delivery.

Residing in El Paso, Texas, Luis – who is originally from Ciudad Juarez, Mexico – has one and a half years of experience as a caterer.  Along with his staff of four, Luis serves any style of party, but to keep up with his business, he ventured to Project Vida, a community education center, for assistance. Project Vida then informed Luis about nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc. 

Luis applied with Accion and was approved $3,275 to purchase foods and secure catering contracts. 
His next goal is to hire three part-time employees. Check out his Facebook for a more personal look into Luis’ love for his business. You can find him here: https://www.facebook.com/taquizaslospistoleros#!/.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and secure catering contracts.

loans.name: Badru

texts.en: Badru is a resident of Nkongoro and a farmer who grows bananas and cereals. He has applied for a 3,000,000 UGX loan to buy a motorcycle to help him transport his goods to the market for selling. It will help him save on transport costs and therefore increase his income. He hopes this will also enable him to make better sales, since it will prevent his goods from being longer on the road as a result of bicycle transport. He is confident that he will grow the partnership into a better venture. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport his produce to the market.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida operates a resident care facility, Psalm 91 in El Paso, Texas.  The business name comes from the Bible passage which begins “Whoever dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.”  Aida’s passion to care for individuals comes from need to help the community and her strong spiritual beliefs.  

Aida has more than seven years of experience in the field and turned to Accion Texas Inc. after being referred from Project Vida in El Paso.  Project Vida provides low cost health care through seven clinics based on a family’s income.  

Once Aida applied for a microloan at Accion, she received the news that she was approved for a $1,650 loan.  She used her Accion loan to repair air conditioning units at her business.  Aida says “the Accion loan helped me improve my resident care.”  

Currently, Aida employs one person at this present time and her long term goal is to hire additional employees to assist her with the residents.

loans.use: to purchase air conditioning units for her facility

loans.name: Dúo Asucenas De Maria Group

texts.es:
Dúo Asucenas de María
 El  grupo está conformado  por las señoras María Isabel de 41 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboración de Tejidos Típicos ( Güipiles y cortes)  desde  hace 25 años ubicada en su domicilio  como también  a la venta de refacciones (venta de panes y atoles) ella se dedica a esta segunda actividad solo los días martes y jueves  en la iglesia de su comunidad, ella necesita otro crédito para invertir en la compra de  hilos y telas   para sus tejidos y tambien para surtir mas su venta de refacciones sus mayor deseo es seguir creciendo y diversificando sus productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena calidad en sus productos y mas variedades,y de esa forma sacar adelante a sus hijos menores, ella ya ha trabajado varios creditos con Kiva/Fape y no a fallado en sus creditos ya que esa es la forma de pagar con bien lo que le han ayudado con sus negocio atravez de los credito.
texts.en:
“Azucenas de María” Duo

María Isabel, 41, is part of this duo.  She has worked at home manufacturing traditional textiles (skirts and blouses) for the last 25 years; she also sells snacks (bread and corn-based beverage).  She does the second activity only on Tuesdays and Thursdays at the church in her community.

She needs another loan to buy thread and fabric for her textiles and also to stock up for her snack sales.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing and diversifying her products to offer her customers good quality products and more variety in order to move her minor children ahead this way.  She’s already managed various loans with Kiva/Fape and has never defaulted on her loans since that’s her way of repaying with goodness for the support she’s gotten for her business by means of the loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
