Felipa, de 62 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en la casa que compró hace 25 años, con mucho trabajo. Conformó su familia junto a su esposo y sus 6 hijos. Ahora solo vive al lado de su yerno y nieto. 
Sufrió la muerte de sus 4 hijos y enviudó hace 6 años, más todas las pruebas que pasó en la vida, no la desmotivó, pues tiene aún nietos e hijos que la quieren y necesitan mucho. Su principal actividad económica es la compra y venta de queso, ya tiene 40 años dedicándose a este oficio. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de queso en una localidad cercana, que se encuentra a 4 horas de su ciudad, ahí Felipa tenía sus propias vacas. Ahora solo se dedica al negocio, pues cuando adquiere los moldes de queso los lleva a la selva central, donde se vende este producto, por lo que puede aumentar el precio de compra y así obtener más ganancias, de igual manera comercializa los moldes a una empresa de contadores, donde 3 veces a la semana lleva el alimento a los profesionales que ya la conocen, saben de la calidad de sus quesos y sobre todo la quieren mucho. Ella es una mujer sencilla y a pesar que se enfermó continua en su negocio. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Felipa, invertirá S/.1000 soles en la compra de queso al por mayor, para abastecer a los clientes que tiene en las diferentes ciudades.
texts.en:
Felipa, 62, is an unassuming woman.  She lives in the house she bought 25 years ago with much effort.  She formed her family with her husband and six children.  Now she lives just with her son-in-law and grandson.

She suffered the deaths of four of her children and was widowed six years ago.  Despite all the life trials she’s gone through she’s not become discouraged because she still has grandchildren and children that love her and need her very much.

Her main economic activity is buying and selling cheese.  She’s been in this line of work for 40 years.  Her work consists in buying cheese in a nearby location that’s 4 hours away from her city.  She then takes the cheese from there to the central jungle where she sells it because she can raise the purchase price there and earn more profits.  She also sells the cheese molds at an accounting firm three times a week; she takes this food item to employees there who already know her and are aware of the quality of her cheeses and who above all love her very much.

She is an unassuming woman who despite being ill continues in business.  This is her third Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue moving forward.  In addition, she commits to make her payments punctually.  Felipa will use the 1,000 soles to buy cheese at wholesale to supply the customers she has in various cities.

loans.use: to buy cheese at wholesale.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es: Camilo vive en la provincia de Paucartambo a  3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre, él saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra hortalizas como por ejemplo papa, cebollas, cebada, etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Camilo lives in Paucartambo Province three hours from the city of Cusco.  He’s 36-years-old and is in a common law relationship.  He supports his family with much effort and dedication since his main economic activity is agriculture and animal husbandry.  He has several fields where he grows vegetables like potato, onion, barley, etc.  He’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

He belongs to the “Santa Ana” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy seeds and manure.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes  qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente et solidarité les membres. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Madame Awa  (mise en médaillon en haut et à  droite), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfant (02 garçons et 02 filles). Elle vend le petit déjeuner dans son quartier. Cette activité, elle la pratique depuis plus de 05 ans et a une bonne maîtrise de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire elle achète en quantité.

Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter : pour le café 5 sachets de café moulu localement et conditionné dans des sachets de 500 grammes à 2 500 F CFA le paquet, un sac de sucre à 18 000 F CFA, du niébé 10 kilos à 600 F CFA le kilo, du lait  et des ingrédients.

 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer dans la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very active in the Banc Villageois created in December 2010.   All the group's members come from the same neighborhood. They get along well with one another and are united by strong solidarity ties. Their main activity is small retail business.

Awa (highlighted in the attached snapshot on the top right of the photo) is the group's featured borrower. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children (two boys and two girls).

She sells breakfast in her neighborhood.  She has been involved in this activity for more than five years and she knows her customers very well.  She buys supplies in bulk quantities.

She will use her loan to buy five 500-gram bags of locally ground coffee at a cost of 2,500 CFA francs per bag, one bag of sugar for 18,000 CFA francs, 10 kilos of black-eyed peas at a cost of 600 CFA francs per kilo, some milk and other food supplies.

The profits from her business will allow Awa to better contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy five bags of locally ground coffee, one bag of sugar, 10 kilos of black-eyed peas, some milk and other food supplies.

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en:
Saidat is married and has four children. None of her children goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business of tailoring, and she has been in this business for 30 years.

Saidat has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more rolls of clothing material. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  She works in a shop, six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of rolls of raw material.  She is aspiring to own a tailoring school, and to build rental rooms. She resides in the family house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Berta Marina

texts.es:
Berta, requiere de un nuevo prestamo porque necesita mas capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio y asi obtener mayores ingresos
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de inventario y utensilios para asimismo vender boquitas tales como: plátanos, yuca, azucar, melon, cubetas, entre otros; este le permitirá adquirir  utilidades  para ayudar a su familia.
Las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado gracias a la inversion del credito anterior.
texts.en:
Berta is in need of a new loan because she needs working capital so she can continue in her business and obtain better income. She will invest the loan that she needs in the purchase of ingredients and utensils so she can sell snacks; supplies include plantains, cassava, sugar, melon, containers, and others. This will permit her to earn profits to help her family. 

Berta's economic conditions and family circumstances have improved thanks to the investment of the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy plantains, cassava, sugar, melon, Para comprar  plátanos, yuca, azucar, melon, containers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dieu Parmi Nous 2 Group

texts.en:
Carine, age 37, is a single mother of 4 children, ages 1 to 16 years old. She has 3 children attending school. She is representing the Dieu Parmi Nous 2 group. Carine sells plastics and has been operating this business for 6 years. She will use the loan to buy more plastics to replenish her stock. Her business strategy is to attract customers to her stand with friendly welcoming greetings. 

Carine has received 6 loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to have many other businesses where she sells a variety of things.

loans.use: to pay for plastics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies and also recyclable items and related products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es: Celso, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos menores en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe.  Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Lleva 5 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 25,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar fertilizantes y darle un buen mantenimiento  a su finca de café y poder aumentar la producción. Su objetivo es tener un mejor nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Celso is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents and younger siblings in a community in the municipality of Taulabe. He has been involved in agriculture ever since he was a boy and has spent the last five years growing coffee. He sells the beans in the local market.

Celso has asked for a loan of 25,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer and maintain his coffee fields so he can boost production. His goal is to achieve a better standard of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and maintain his coffee fields

loans.name: Akwadu Group

texts.en:
Rebecca (standing extreme left) is the representative of her group "Akwadu". She is married and has two children. She lives in the city of Accra with good business potential. Rebecca is 37 years old and has been running her business for the last 15 years.

She would like to use this loan to invest in purchasing maize (corn) and vegetables. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. She is requesting a loan amount of GHS 800 to expand her business.
 
Other members of "Akwadu group" are Regina, Grace, Lydia, Comfort, Gladys and Mary, and have need of a loan for businesses like selling fish, cooking oil, cooking utensils and wax-print. The eighth person in that photograph is the leader who came to organize for the photograph.

This is their 5th loan with ID-Ghana and 2nd loan cycle with Kiva. They need a total amount of GHS 6,100 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase maize (corn) and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina tiene 68 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo.  Lina se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como bebidas, arroz, azúcar y otros. Su local está constituido en el interior de su propia casa. Su actividad es constante y se inicia con la compra de todos los productos comestibles más saludables y frescos en el mercado de la ciudad, cuando ya tiene lo que necesita lo ofrece a la venta en su establecimiento. Su negocio empezó hace más de 20 años y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Comenta que realizando esta actividad se divierte y la pasa muy bien, y ahora está muy contenta con todo lo que ha obtenido con el paso de los años. Tiene muchas metas siendo la principal de ellas el de ampliar su tienda y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas.  Se compromete a ser una socia puntual con cada uno de sus pagos. Con el monto solicitado comprará más mercaderías y productos para ofrecer a sus clientes como arroz, azúcar, leches y otros productos.
texts.en:
Lina is 68 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the house they own. 

Lina earns her living selling staple products like drinks, rice, sugar, and others. Her business is located in the interior of her house. She works constantly, beginning with the purchase of all the healthiest and freshest groceries in the city market. When she has what she needs, she sells it in her establishment. She started her business more than twenty years ago, and she has always had her husband's support. She says that running her business is fun and she enjoys it, and now she is very happy with all that she has accomplished as the years have passed. She has many goals, the main one being expanding her shop so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers. 

At this time, she is requesting 2,500 PEN. She is very happy to know that she has a source of economic support so that she can continue advancing toward accomplishing her goals. She promises to pay each of her payments punctually. With the requested amount, she will purchase more merchandise and products to offer her customers, like rice, sugar, milk, and other goods.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business, like rice, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Ania Lucrecia

texts.es: Ania, habitante de un barrio marginal de Managua llamado Carlos Núñez, ella es una jovencita quien busca como salir adelante con su familia, esposo e hija quien esta pequeña aun. Ania es una humilde joven que no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria por sus limitaciones económicas, hoy en día su único medio de ingresos es una pequeña pulpería con la que se ayuda y desea invertir con más productos. Por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos, productos enlatados, gaseosa, jugos, verduras, carne para ofrecer sus clientes, los vecinos del barrio.
texts.en:
Ania lives in a poor neighbourhood in Managua called Carlos Núñez. She is a young woman seeking a way to get ahead in life with her husband and a young daughter. Ana is a simple person who couldn't attend university because of a lack of funds.

Today her sole source of income is a small grocery. She wants to buy more products for the store so is seeking a loan to buy basic grains, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, vegetables, and meat to sell to her customers who are from her neighbourhood.

loans.use: buy basic grains, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 59 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junta su familia. Esther se dedica a realizar diseños y costura de prendas de vestir. Ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y luego estudió en un centro de educación ocupacional, ahora tiene su propio taller donde atiende con mucha paciencia a sus clientes. 
Le gusta  su negocio pues cuenta con un oficio e ingresos económicos fijos que le permiten sostener la economía de su hogar. Espera que su negocio sea más conocido con el paso del tiempo y para ello está dispuesta a continuar trabajando. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de  todas sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para seguir con su trabajo de costura como telas, hilos, botones, cierres y elásticos que usa para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Esther is 59 years old, married and lives in her own house alongside her family. Esther works in the design and sewing of garments. She learned from a very young age alongside her mother and later studied at a center for occupational education. Now she has her own workshop, where she patiently assists her clients. She likes her business since she has a profession and a steady income that allows her to maintain her household. With time she hopes for her business to become more well known and she is prepared to continue working for it. 

On this occasion Esther is requesting 500 Nuevo Soles. She is very happy for the financial support offered to her so she can continue with her work. She promises prompt payment on all her installments. With the sum she has applied for, she will buy materials to continue with her sewing work, such as fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and elastic.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and other items for her garment design business.

loans.name: Javan

texts.en:
Javan is a 28-year-old, single man. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a farming business. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a rural area, and his primary customers are wholesale traders. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate capital for expansion.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to obtain more seeds of potatoes, to enable him to increase production. This is his first application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to obtain more seeds of potatoes, which will enable him to increase production.

loans.name: Alexandrine's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Alexandrine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 23 ans. Alexandrine a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Alexandrine est mariée à Éric. Le couple a un enfant qui n’est pas encore scolarisé mais est à leur charge. Alexandrine vit avec son mari et son enfant. Alexandrine et son mari assurent ensemble les charges du ménage. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Alexandrine vend des perles depuis une quinzaine d'année de façon ambulante. Alexandrine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Alexandrine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group has three members, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Alexandrine, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 23 years of age, and left school when she was in secondary education. She is married to Eric, and they have one child who is not yet at school, but is under their care. 

Alexandrine lives with her husband and her child, and together the couple makes sure that the various household expenses are covered. To provide for the household, Alexandrine has worked for about 15 years selling pearls on the street. She gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. In order to consolidate her business and satisfy customer demand, Alexandrine has requested a loan from ALIDé along with the other members of the group.

loans.use: To buy pearls.

loans.name: Marguérite's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe composé de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marguérite (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 57 ans. Marguérite n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marguérite ne vit plus avec son mari, mais est mère de deux enfants qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Aucun des enfants n’est scolarisé. Marguérite vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Pour ce faire, Marguérite vend des produits divers, tels que des œufs, du riz, du sucre, du haricot depuis une trentaine d’année par la méthode de distribution. Marguérite s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Marguérite s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe  pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group has three members, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Marguérite, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 57 years of age, and never attended school. She no longer lives with her husband, but is a mother to two children who are no longer under her care. Her children are not at school.

Marguérite lives alone, and is solely responsible for providing for herself. To do this, she works selling various products via the distribution system, such as eggs, rice and sugar, and has done so for about 30 years. She gets her supplies from a market in Bénin. 

In order to increase her turnover and meet customer demand, Marguérite has joined the other members of her group to request their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: To buy trays of eggs and various other items.

loans.name: Bintou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes  qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente et solidarité les membres. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Bintou (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05  enfants (2 Garçons et 03 filles). Elle est vendeuse de poissons secs et de patte d’arachide. Pour le premier cité, elle achète par panier  de 10 kg à 6 000 F CFA le panier pour la revente par kg à 1 000 F CFA ou par détail à 100 , 200  et plus selon les besoins du client. Concernant la patte d’arachide, elle achète des seaux de 20 litres à 15 000 F CFA  pour la revente à 1 000 ou en sachet de 250 F CFA.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner poisson sec pour 06 paniers au plus à 6000 F CFA et en patte d’arachide pour 02 seaux à 15 000 l’un.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner d’une part pour accroître sa capacité de financement et d’apporter son  soutien son marie dans gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who all come from the same neighborhood and who are very active in the Banc Villageois created in December 2010. They get along well with one another and are united by strong solidarity ties. Their main activity is small retail business.

Bintou (standing at the far right of the photo and raising her left hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls).

She sells dried fish and groundnut paste.  She buys dried fish by baskets of 10 kilos (at a cost of 6,000 CFA francs per basket).  She resells fish on a retail basis charging 1,000 CFA francs per kilo, or charging 100, 200 francs or more per fish, if fish is sold separately, depending on her customers' needs.  She also buys groundnut paste by the bucket (each bucket weighing 20 liters and costing 15,000 CFA francs).  She resells groundnut paste 1,000 francs (per liter) or in 250-francs bags.

She plans to use her loan to buy six baskets of dried fish for a maximum price of 6,000 CFA francs (per basket) and two buckets of groundnut paste, each costing 15,000 francs.

Bintou will put part of her profits into savings in order to increase her financing capacity, and will use the remaining money to help her husband manage the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy six baskets of dried fish and two buckets of groundnut paste.

loans.name: Céline's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe composé de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. Céline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est la représente du groupe. Agée de 44 ans, Céline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Céline est mariée à Justin, un commerçant. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les charges du ménage sont assurées par Céline et son mari. Pour ce faire, Céline vend des vivres (maïs, riz, sucre, haricot) à son domicile depuis douze ans. Céline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de satisfaire la demande de ses clients et pour une bonne gestion de son activité, Céline s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group has three members, who all live in the same neighborhood. Céline is the group’s representative, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 44 years of age, and did not go to school. She is marked to Justin, a retailer, and the couple has three children, all at school and all under their care. 

Céline and her husband ensure that the various household expenses are covered. To do so, Céline has worked for the past 12 years selling staple food items from home (corn, rice, sugar and beans). She gets her supplies from a market in Bénin. 

In order to increase her working capital so that she can meet customer demand, as well as to better manage her business, Céline has joined the other members of her group to request their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy staple food items (corn, rice, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Dieu Parmi Nous 1 Group

texts.en:
Gordon, age 26, is married and has two children, ages 3 and 7 years. The oldest is going to school. Gordon is representing the Dieu Parmi Nous 1 Group.

He has a small hardware stand, and a cell phone card stand. He has been operating these two small businesses for 2.5 years. He will use his share of the loan to buy various hardware store items and prepaid phone cards. His business strategy is to give friendly and helpful customer service. This is Gordon's first loan with HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and his group are confident he will repay the loan. Gordon hopes to grow his businesses, through the loan.

loans.use: to pay for hardware store merchandise and prepaid phone cards, which he will sell at his stands.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

My name is Aurora, and I am 62 years old.  I started selling food 20 years ago.  In the beginning I sold quesadillas, pambazos, pozole and other typical mexican food.  Then I sold tacos, and two years ago I began to sell corn and corn products in the street.

I will use this loan to refurbish my food stall and to buy a plastic canvas to cover it in the rainy season.  My biggest accomplishment is owning a house and providing financial stability for my children.

loans.use: To refurbish my food stall and buy materials to protect it in the rainy season.

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 70 años de edad, vive sola en una colonia del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Ella lleva 7 años de tener una pulpería donde vende azúcar, manteca, churros, pastillas, refrescos, lácteos, granos básicos, pan, café, galletas etc. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Ha obtenido varios préstamos con ODEF para mantener su negocio. Actualmente solicita el noveno ciclo de préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir el negocio con productos básicos como carnes, refrescos, churros, pan, café, manteca y granos básicos. Su plan es que con las ganancias va terminar el cerco de su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is 70 years old and lives alone in a neighborhood in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. She has had her grocery store for 7 years, where she sells sugar, butter, chips, over-the-counter medicines, soft drinks, dairy products, staple grains, bread, coffee, cookies, etc. She has always worked in commerce.

She has obtained several loans with ODEF to maintain her business. Currently, she is requesting her 9th loan cycle for 15,000 Lempiras, with which she will stock her business with basic commodities such as meat, soft drinks, chips, bread, coffee, butter, and staple grains. Her plan is that with her income she will finish the fence around her house.

loans.use: to stock her business with basic commodities such as meat, soft drinks, chips, bread, coffee, butter, and staple grains.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

My name is Julia, and I am 34 years old.  I finished high school and then started working.  I live in a house with my husband and two children.  I am a hard-working woman and do a lot of things - I sell gifts, cosmetics, provide massages and also make and sell different types of clothing.  I will use this loan to buy a sewing machine, so that I will be able to make more clothing and of better quality to gain extra income.

My biggest accomplishment was buying a piece of land and starting the construction of my house.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine so she can make and sell clothing.

loans.name: Bon Samaritain 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine, age 48, is a widow with five children, 16 to 35 years old. Her youngest is currently in school. She is representing the Bon Samaritain 2 (1) Group.

Alphonsine has a food stand and small butcher shop. She has been selling food items in the market for 25 years. She has many years of experience, and a strong presence in the market where she operates. She will use the loan to buy potatoes, onions, carrots, beef, and chicken. Her business strategy is to be open and friendly with her customers. 

Alphonsine has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to build a house for herself and her kids, with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to pay for potatoes, onions, carrots, beef, and chicken, to resell at her market stand.

loans.name: Nunga 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Sidonie, age 38, is a single mother with two children, ages two and four years old. The four-year-old is attending school. Sidonie is representing the Nunga 2 (1) group. She has a small bakery shop where she sells her homemade baked goods. She has been operating this small business fro 10 years. She will use the loan to buy eggs, flour, oil, sugar, yeast, butter, and chocolate. Her business strategy is to have an actual structure to house her business. She feels it gives her business a competitive edge to have a nice looking shop. 

This is Sidonie's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and her group are confident she will repay the loan. She hopes to continue with her business far into the future.

loans.use: to pay for eggs, flour, oil, sugar, yeast, butter, and chocolate.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story:

My name is Lucas.  I have been married for 15 years and have 3 sons: 14, 12 and 4 years old.  I bought a home but currently I am using it as my workshop, so I live in another house with some relatives.  I make and sell rustic furniture such as bases for beds and wardrobes. 

I will use this loan to buy some materials for furniture making.  If I buy in larger volumes, I can obtain better prices and make larger profits.  Also, at the moment, I have some requests from clients and I will be able to deliver the furniture faster with this loan.  I am a responsible, hard working person and like to pay my debts on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials for furniture making such as plywood sheets, pine boards, glue and polishes.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.en:
Evaristo Villa is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story:

My name is Evaristo.  I am 54 years old and live with my wife Maria Guadalupe - we are a solid couple.

I sell and rent wood and formwork and have been doing it for the last 25 years.  The name of my project is First Quality Wood and my slogan is the client comes first.  I will use to this loan to buy more inventory and increase my sales.  I have always paid on time and maintained a good credit history.  My biggest accomplishments are owning a house and a business and my goal is to make my business grow.

loans.use: To buy wood and formwork

loans.name: Frank

texts.es:
Frank tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su hermana y su cuñado. Frank se dedica a la venta de bebidas, tiene un convenio con esa empresa que le ofreces sus productos a precios y eso le permite obtener mejores ganancias económicas por sus ventas. Lleva cumpliendo este trabajo desde hace 1 año y en este tiempo aprendió a desarrollar el negocio con buenos resultados. Trabaja solo y se siente cómodo e independiente generando sus propios ingresos económicos cuyas ganancias invierte en sus estudios. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, se siente a gusto pudiendo repartir su tiempo entre las actividades de su casa y sus actividades académicas, está muy contento porque va bien por el momento. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto solicitado progresivamente mayor cantidad de gaseosas para su venta diaria.
texts.en:
21-year old Frank is single and lives in his parents' house together with his sister and brother-in-law. He earns his living selling soft drinks. He has an agreement with a company which provides him with drinks at low prices. This in turn allows him to make a profit on his sales. He's had the business for a year now and has learned a lot about running a business with good results.

Frank works alone and likes being independent and earning his own money. He uses his earnings to pay for his education. He enjoys his work very much and likes being able to divide his spare time between family activities and studying.

He is now seeking a loan of S/. 1,500. He is grateful to all those people who provide him with this financial opportunity which he needs in order to be able to continue working. He promises to make the repayments. With the loan money he will buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: Buy more soft drinks for his store

loans.name: Volonte Divine 3 (2) Group

texts.en:
Joel, age 41, is married with four children, ages 4 to 19 years old. He has three children currently attending school. He is representing the Volonte Divine 3 (2) group. Joel has a hardware shop where he sells a variety of items. He has had this business for 20 years. He will use the loan to replenish his hardware merchandise, such as nails, screws, hammers, and hand saws. His business strategy is to be a good salesman. He has many years of experience and can offer his customers advice about their construction projects. He also tries to keep a large variety of merchandise stocked at all times. 

Joel has received five previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to open a large hardware shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for hardware store merchandise.

loans.name: Volonte Divine 3 (1) Group

texts.en:
Patrick represents the Volonte Divine 3 (1) group. He is forty, married and has two children aged three and sixteen years old. The older child is currently attending school.

For the last eleven years Patrick has sold large plastic travel bags. His business strategy is to barter with customers to get the best price. He sells the bags one at a time or in bulk, so the price differs according to how many the customer buys.

Patrick has received four previous loans through HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner, and has a good repayment record. He is now applying for a 2,100,000 XAF loan for his group. He will use his fourth of the loan to buy more bags to sell.

Patrick would like to open a big store one day. He hopes his children will finish their education and be able to travel to other countries.

loans.use: to buy more large plastic travel bags to sell.

loans.name: Les Enfants Unis 4 (2) Group

texts.en:
Marie represents the Les Enfants Unis 4 (2) group. She is 45, married and has five children aged six to 25 years old. Four of her children are attending school.

For the past fifteen years Marie has sold sandals at the market. Her business strategy is to call her loyal customers and let them know when she has new sandals at her stand.

Marie has received two previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, and has a good repayment record. She is now applying for a 2,500,000 XAF loan for her group. She will use her fifth to buy more sandals to sell.

In the future, Marie wants to have a store in which to house her business. Her wish is to buy a piece of land for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sandals to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 7 años de edad, el tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende refrescos, golosinas, dulce, granos básicos  y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia. El busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda, como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, granos básicos,  etc.  lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Francisco, 31, lives in his own house with his wife and his 7-year-old son. He has a small store where he sells sodas, candy, sweets, basic grains and other edible and non-edible goods. Through this business he has gotten his family ahead. 

He is looking to improve his quality of life, therefore he is asking for a loan to increase the variety of his goods in his store, like: basic grains, sodas, candy, etc. This will permit him to increase the profits of his business and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, candy, etc.

loans.name: Prosperite 4 Group

texts.en:
Laurent represents the Prosperite 4 group. He is 54, married and has five children aged two to 24 years. Four of them are currently attending school.

For the past three years Laurent has had a business selling car parts and motor oil. His business strategy is to be attentive to clients and offer them friendly customer service.

Laurent has received six previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner, and has a good repayment record. He is now applying for a 2,900,000 XAF loan for his group and plans to use his portion of the loan to buy more motor oil to stock in his store. He hopes to continue to develop his business and open up more car parts stores around Brazzaville in the future.

Laurent dreams of making a large amount of money to save and give to his children when he dies. In Congo, funerals are very expensive and many families go into debt trying to pay for everything. As well as wanting to leave his children a small inheritance, he doesn't want to burden them with funeral expenses.

loans.use: to buy more motor oil to sell

loans.name: Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Esperanza De Vida Con EL Futuro” conformado por 08 socios trabajadores que el transcurso del tiempo han demostrado ser personas responsables, dicho grupo pasan a su 7mo ciclo. Reina de 46 años es casada con 03 hijos, 01 de ellos aún en etapa escolar. Reina se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. Gracias a su trabajo puede seguir apoyando a su familia. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de chompas, casacas, pantalones y chalinas. El grupo está agradecido con el crédito brindado, ya que hacen posible su progreso.  Reina se encuentra en la parte de adelante es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa ploma y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
This is the group "Esperanza De Vida Con El Futuro" [Hope of Life with a Future], made up of 8 working members. The passage of time has shown them to be responsible people; this group is entering its 7th loan cycle. 

Reina, 46, is married with three children, one of whom is still in school. Reina sells garments as a street vendor. Thanks to her work she can continue supporting her family. Her last loan will be used for the purchase of sweaters, coats, pants and scarves. 

The group is thankful for the provided loan, given that it makes their progress possible. Reina can be found in the front of the photo. She is the first woman on the left side and is wearing a grey sweater and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, coats, pants, and scarves.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 19 años de edad vive en la hermosa ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico, conocida nacionalmente también como “Curramba La Bella”. Es un joven en estado civil soltero, vive actualmente con sus padres. Su negocio consiste en la elaboración y venta de comidas rápidas, como son: empanadas, arepas, buñuelos, perros calientes y chichas. Estos productos los vende a los vecinos del barrio, y a personas que pasan ocasionalmente por el sector, las ventas son de contado. El negocio funciona todos los días de seis (6) de la mañana hasta las nueve (9) de la noche, su mamá le ayuda en la preparación de los alimentos. Las compras de los insumos las hace de contado en graneros del barrio y del mercado central de la ciudad. Desde hace un (1) año recibió de su padre este negocio, debido a que su padre comenzó a trabajar en una empresa. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de insumos como harinas, huevos, maíz, y carnes. Con esta inversión mejorará sus ingresos al comprar al por mayor una sola vez por semana, ya que antes lo hacía tres (3) veces por semana, encareciendo sus costos y gastos. Sus metas son: 1) Ampliar sus productos a la línea de asados, para posicionarse bien en el sector. 2) Comprar una casa en el barrio.
texts.en:
Oscar, 19, lives in the beautiful city of Barranquilla in the department of Atlántico, also known nationally as “Curramba La Bella.” He is single and lives with his parents. He operates a business, making and selling fast foods like empanadas, corn flatbreads, fried dough balls, hot dogs, and rice drinks. He sells his food to neighbors and pedestrians, who pay in cash. His business is open every day from 6 AM until 9 PM. His mother helps prepare the food. He pays cash for his supplies to local farmers and merchants in the city's central market. His father gave him the business a year ago when he went to work for a company.

This is his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy supplies like flour, eggs, corn, and meats. This loan will let him increase his income by buying wholesale supplies once a week, instead of three times a week, which made costs and expenses higher. His goals are: 1) to offer more grilled items and be more competitive in the area; and 2) to buy a house in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, eggs, corn, and meats to make fried foods and hot dogs.

loans.name: Prosperite 3 Group

texts.en:
Adrienne represents the Prosperite 3 group. She is 51, single and has two children aged 20 and 26 years old. The 20-year-old is currently attending university.

For the past twenty years Adrienne has sold clothes in the market. She has gained many valuable customers over the years. Her business strategy is to talk to her customers and offer friendly customer service. She sees people walking by her shop and invites them in to see her clothes for sale.

Adrienne has received six previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She is now applying for a 2,800,000 XAF loan for her group and will use her portion to buy more clothing to sell.

Adrienne would like to begin selling salted fish in the future. She feels this is a good business and would like to diversify.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Prosperite 2 Group

texts.en:
Gertrude represents the Prosperite 2 Group. She is 45, married and has two children aged sixteen and eighteen years old. They are both currently attending school.

For the past twenty years Gertrude has sold clothes at the market. She has gained a good reputation in her community, and many people know about her shop. Her business strategy is to publicize her business in her community.

Gertrude has received six previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner, and has a good repayment record. She is applying for a 2,200,000 XAF loan for her group and will use her portion to buy more clothes to build up her clothing stock.

In the future she would like to sell clothes in bulk to vendors instead of being a vendor herself. She hopes her business thrives far into the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to build up her clothing stock.

loans.name: Prosperite 1 Group

texts.en:
Denise represents the Prosperite 1 Group. She is 33 and a single mother with two children aged seven and ten years old. They are both attending school.

For the past ten years Denise has sold clothes in a local market. Her business strategy is to do a lot of marketing of her business in the market and her community. She also feels it is important to be kind and helpful to her customers.

Denise has received six previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner, and has a good repayment record. She is now applying for a 2,600,000 XAF loan for her group and will use her portion to buy more clothes to replenish her stock. She wants to be a successful business woman with a large clothing store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to replenish her stock.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 42 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей (2 дочери и 1 сын).  После окончания средней школы Дамира работала в швейном цеху. С 1991 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10 000 сом(KGS).  Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 5000  сом(KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Дамиры, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 2 дойные коровы, 30 овец, 4 лошади. Также в наличии имеет 1,24 ГА поливной земли.  Прибыль позволила Дамире размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дамира обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи, а также на покупку минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Дамира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Damira is 42 years old, married and has three children (two daughters and one son).  Damira worked at a sewing factory after finishing a secondary school.  She has been involved in an agricultural business - animal husbandry and farming - since 1991, having started this business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  The monthly income from the business amounts to 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Damira's hard work, today she has a good farm, containing two dairy cows, thirty sheep and four horses.  She also has 1.24 hectares of irrigated land.  The profit allowed Damira to increase livestock on her farm and, thus, improve the family welfare.  In order to further develop her business, Damira requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy livestock for fattening up and resale and also to buy mineral fertilizers for treating the land.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening up and resale and also to buy mineral fertilizers for treating the land

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.en:
This is 66-year-old Dorcas and and 27-year-old Patience, from Teshie. They are the members of Dorcas Group. Dorcas is a grandmother of three. 

Dorcas runs a plastic products business in front of her house. The business has been in operation for 25 years. She says the main challenge she is facing is that of stiff competition. 

Dorcas has requested a loan of GHS 900 in order to purchase plastic items to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her an increase in income and, therefore, improve her grandchildren's lives. In the future, Dorcas plans to open a shop in town.

Dorcas Group needs a total of amount of GHS 1700 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase plastic items to resell to customers.

loans.name: Loh Martou

texts.en:
Loh Martou is married with five children and lives in a three-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda, North West Province, of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life including inadequate finances for her business and for her family needs, the death of her son and another child's accident.
With the new loan requested, she will buy and sell palm oil, maize, beans and groundnuts. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has regular customers who buy from her both wholesale and retail. Loh Martou has a good business site and high demand in her area of residence. With this business activity, the community will benefit because food items will always be available, she will sell to them at reduced prices, and she will ensure a regular supply to her customers.
With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs and ensure her children are educated. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment schedules and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buying items such as maize beans, groundnuts and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothes, shoes, blankets, skirts, jeans, and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es: Beatriz Elena es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada y madre de 5 hijos. Vive en una vereda en la zona rural de Marinilla, donde hace aproximadamente 14 años tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, confitería, mecato, entre otros productos. Beatriz es una persona trabajadora y lucha día a día por conseguir el sustento para su familia, pero en ocasiones se le dificulta hacerlo, ya que algunos clientes tardan en cancelar las deudas y esto no le permite tener flujo de caja y por ende no tiene dinero para comprar suficiente surtido. Con el crédito que solicita desea realizar mejoras en el negocio y comprar más surtido (productos lácteos, mecato, galletería, confitería, gaseosas, productos de la canasta familiar), con el fin de generar una mejor percepción de los clientes que la visitan y tener más surtido para así aumentar sus ventas. Su principal sueño es tener la oportunidad de continuar con su negocio, haciendo que las ventas aumenten, tener más clientes para ofrecerles un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Beatriz Elena, 48, is married and has five children. She lives on a street in the rural area of Marinilla. For about 14 years, she has owned a shop, where she sells groceries, candy, produce, and other items. Beatriz works hard and strives every day to support her family, though sometimes she finds that hard, as some customers pay their bills late. This reduces her cash flow, which means she doesn't have enough money to buy inventory. 

She will use this loan to make improvements to her business and buy inventory (milk products, produce, cookies, candy, sodas, and household items) so that her customers will have a good impression of her business and visit often and so that she will have more inventory and higher sales. Her main dream is to continue running her business, to increase sales, and to offer better service to even more customers.

loans.use: to make improvements to her business and buy inventory (milk products, produce, cookies, candy, sodas, and household items).

loans.name: Tsafack

texts.en:
Tsafack is married with one child and lives in a three-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Province of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life including inadequate finances to start up a business and meet her family's needs. Marital problems also have been a major difficulty.  
With this loan Tsafack plans to buy rice and groundnuts to sell. Part of the loan will be invested in farming by buying seed. She will also buy feed for her pigs and use the rest to run the business. She believes the business will succeed because she has been running it for a long time and the high demand for food stuffs in the region has provided a market for her items, With this business activity, the community will benefit because some people will buy seedlings from her at low prices to plant on their farms. Also, the high demand for pork meat in town provides her with a good market for her pigs.
With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs, ensure her child’s education, and will renovate her residence. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment schedules and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy rice and groundnuts to sell, seed for planting and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Sirri

texts.en:
Sirri is a widow and a mother of three children. She lives in a five-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Province of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life including inadequate finances to start up a business of her own and meet her family's needs, plus sickness and death of family members.
With this new loan requested, Sirri will buy piglets and feed for them and supplies for akra, a dish made of fried banana and cassava.  Sirri holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and has regular customers who buy her akra early in the morning and the demand for pigs is high. In addition to that, the waste from pigs is used on the farm to get a high yield. With this business activity, the community will benefit from pig waste (manure) which will be used for farming, cassava from the farm as food, and her akra consumed mostly by school children. 
With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs, ensure her children's education, expand her business and also save some money to undertake a bigger business investment. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment schedules and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Plus, the social needs of members are met at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed for them, plus supplies for akra (fried cassava and banana)

loans.name: Jomaira Valeria

texts.es:
Jomaira es una jovencita de 21 años, soltera, tuvo la oportunidad de terminar la escuela primaria gracias al apoyo de su familia. Su madre la motivó para que aprenda la labor en corte y confección para que pueda crecer en esta rama, sin embargo a ella le gustaría continuar aprendiendo y especializándose. Jomaira tiene un hijo a quien lo ha educado con su esfuerzo y trabajo y vive con él y su madre en la ciudad de Quito capital de la República del Ecuador en donde se encuentran muchas personas migrantes de las diferentes provincias del país que han llegado hasta allí en busca de nuevas oportunidades. Jomaira reside en la parroquia de Tumbaco, un lugar que guarda historias incaicas en su suelo y leyendas de monarcas. El clima y el territorio dan oportunidad a sus habitantes para desarrollar actividades de agricultura y crianza de animales, además las artesanías en tela, lana y cerámica también son muy frecuentes allí. 
Jomaira se dedica a la confección de ropa y maquila, gracias al apoyo de su madre, ella elabora un trabajo profesional con cada prenda o tela que llega a sus manos. Invierte al menos nueve horas cada día en la confección de ropa que le realizan bajo pedido de sus clientes que ha ganado con recomendaciones por cada trabajo realizado. A pesar de su condición de madre soltera, Jomaira no se ha dado por vencida y ha entregado a su hijo lo mejor de ella. Es por eso que ahora Jomaira aspira comprar una nueva máquina bordadora que le permita elaborar diseños nuevos, diferentes y originales para todos los gustos; para lo cual ha solicitado un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa quienes le abrieron las puertas para poder financiar este paso de crecimiento en su vida profesional lo cual no lo había podido dar antes por la falta de capital, sin embargo hoy gracias a la intervención de Kiva lo puede realizar y así con los ingresos adicionales que su negocio genere pueda brindar a su hijo una educación de calidad y además pueda cumplir su sueño de seguir estudiando para ser una profesional de excelencia.
texts.en:
Jomaira is 21 and single. She finished elementary school with her family's support. He mother encouraged her to learn tailoring and dressmaking so that she could become skilled in this profession, and she wanted to keep learning and specializing. 

Jomaira has a son, for whom she has worked hard to provide an education, and she lives with him and her mother in Quito, the capital of Ecuador. Many people from other provinces in the country come to Quito to find new opportunities. Jomaira lives in Tumbaco parish, where Incan stories and royal legends are preserved. The weather provides residents the chance to pursue farming and raising livestock. Making cloth, wool, and ceramic handicrafts is common as well.

Jomaira makes clothing; she professionally works with each garment and fabric that she touches. She spends at least nine hours a day making clothing to fill orders for customers, whom she has acquired through recommendations based on her work. Despite being a single mother, Jomaira has not given up and gives her son the best she can. Now Jomaira wants to buy a new embroidery machine to make all kinds of new, different, and original designs. She has applied for a loan through Fundación Alternativa, which opens doors for funding to grow professionally, something Jomaira has not had the capital to do. Thanks to Kiva's intervention, she will be able to do so. With the additional business income, she can offer her son a good education and realize her dream to continue her studies and become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Vivian Kiyeh

texts.en:
Vivian is married with five children and lives in a three-bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Province of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life including inadequate finances to carry out her business, thieves breaking into her house and stealing household items, meeting her family's needs, the death of loved ones and other family issues.
Vivian will invest the loan by buying a new bike for her son for a transportation business, clearing her farm for cultivation, and buying seeds to plant. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been in this business for a long time. These businesses will benefit the community because the bike will help transport people from one place to another and the farming will provide food.
With the profit from the loan, Vivian will continue to educate her children, to cater to her family's needs and invest the rest in her business. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment schedules and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy a bike, pay for cultivating her farm and buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Mbi

texts.en:
Mbi is a widow who lives with five of her children in a six-room apartment in Bamenda North West Province of Cameroon. She has been facing many problems in life including the death of her relatives, illnesses, attacks by bandits on her business site and poverty as the main ill.
She has taken out and successfully repaid her loans three times and says if this present request is granted, she will buy more drinks and food to stock up in her place so that she can better serve her customers. Mbi believes her business, which she has been involved in for years, will succeed because there is great demand in her area and customers do not have to go to town since she is already at their doorsteps. 
With the profit from this business, she will rent farmland to do some farming in food crops, pay her children’s school fees and improve her status by constructing her own compound. She prefers a GHAPE loan because borrowers are being taught management and marketing techniques and their interest rates are low, and to be paid over a considerable time period.

loans.use: To buy drinks and food to sell

loans.name: Maria Ermelinda

texts.pt:
Maria é casada, vive na casa própria e tem 40 anos de idade. Possui 3 filhos com 5, 10 e 15 anos. Os dois primeiros estudam e frequentam 5ª e 9ª classes.
Maria é negociante há mais de 10 anos e vende produtos alimentares	num estabelecimento na sua casa. O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de açúcar, farinha e cervejas para revenda. Maria tem a esperança de fazer crescer o seu negócio e para isso disse que irá pedir mais empréstimos.           
Os principais desafios são terminar a ampliação da sua casa, construindo mais 2 quartos, comprar mobília e comprar uma viatura para transporte de produtos comercializados.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old. She is married and lives in her own home. She has three children who are 5, 10, and 15 years of age. The two eldest go to school and are in the fifth and ninth grades.
For more than 10 years, Maria has had a business selling groceries from a shop in her home. She will use this loan to buy products for her business such as sugar, flour, and beer. Maria hopes to expand her business, and will request more loans for that purpose in the future.
Her main challenges are to finish expanding her house, building two more rooms, and to buy furniture and a vehicle to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and beer to resell.

loans.name: Martine's Group

texts.fr: C'est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Martine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 33 ans. Martine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Martine est une veuve, qui vit avec ses deux enfants. Parmi les enfants, seulement un est scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Martine. Pour cette raison, Martine vend des sacs de charbon de bois à son domicile depuis neuf ans. Martine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Martine s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This is a group of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Their representative is Martine (with her hand raised in the photo), age 33. Martine never went to school. She is a widow who lives with her two dependent children, one of whom goes to school. 

Martine is solely responsible for the household expenses. To that end, she has been selling sacks of charcoal from her home for nine years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To strengthen her activity, Martine is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marie-Claude's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Marie-Claude (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), est la représente de ce groupe. Marie-Claude est âgée de 36 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Marie-Claude n’a pas d’enfant. Marie-Claude vit seule et assure ses différents besoins. Marie-Claude n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie-Claude vend des boules d’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) et du poisson à son domicile depuis une dizaine d’années. Marie-Claude s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Marie-Claude s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This is a group of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Their representative is Marie-Claude (with her hand raised in the photo), age 36. Marie-Claude no longer lives with her husband, and she doesn’t have any children. She lives alone and supports herself. She never went to school. 

To earn a living, Marie-Claude has been selling akassa balls (a dish made of starch and maize) and fish from her home for about 10 years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To strengthen her activity, she is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy maize and fish.

loans.name: Leidy Marilu

texts.es:
La  señora Leydi de 27 años, vive con su hijo  en su casa de habitación en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 06 años a la elaboración y venta de vestidos, pantalones de mujer, pantalones de hombre, trajes de señora, etc. Y también vende lo que es productos de la canasta familiar, como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, pollo, carne etc.
Doña Leydi su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que el visitan de diferentes lugares los cuales le prefieren por su buena atención y amabilidad.
Doña Leydi está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas de máquina y adornos para sus diferentes diseños que hace en la sastrería y compra de abarrotería en general,  ella está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma ya que con la ayuda de los préstamos que se le han brindado a podido ampliar su negocio.
Doña Leydi su sueño ampliar su negocio y salir adelante con  la educación de su hijo.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio  del 2013
texts.en:
Leydi, 27, lives with her son in her house in the town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. For six years, she has been making and selling dresses, women's and men's pants, women's suits, and more. She also sells household goods like rice, beans, shortening, chicken, and meats. Leydi's business is in her house, and her customers are neighbors and friends, who come from various areas because they like her good service and friendliness. 

Leydi has applied for a loan to buy fabric, thread, machine needles, and accessories for the designs she creates in her tailoring workshop and to buy groceries. She is pleased to be working with Prisma, as the financing has given her the opportunity to grow her business. Leydi dreams of growing her business and educating her son. 
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, machine needles, and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
As a married parent, Modesta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Modesta is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her business.

Modesta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy more supplies for her restaurant business.

Ofelia has been in this business for 15 years. Ofelia also earns income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to build her restaurant and general store business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her restaurant business

loans.name: Broulaye

texts.en:
Broulaye is a farmer in Gwelekoro Village.  He is 44 years old and married with 6 children.  He is a 2nd year farmer with myAgro.  Broulaye would like a loan for a semoir, which is a local seeding machine that has 2 boxes: one for seed and one for fertilizer.  The semoir is attached to a cow that will pull the semoir along the field, and there are diggers and a pipe behind each box that will place the correct amount of seed and fertilizer the right distance apart.  This enables farmers to plant using the micro-dosing method of planting – using a small amount of fertilizer per plant instead of the traditional method of broadcasting fertilizer.  This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and is much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Broulaye will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income.

Broulaye would like a semoir loan because it would facilitate planting and make it less expensive.  Before, Broulaye planted manually which was time-consuming and made it difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Broulaye’s goals are to feed his family and send his children to school.  Broulaye says myAgro helps him reach his goals by continuing to provide quality inputs and good agricultural trainings.  Broulaye will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income.  All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment

loans.name: Mekoro

texts.en:
Mekoro is a farmer in Gwelekoro Village.  He is 34 years old and married with 2 children.  He is a 2nd year farmer with myAgro.  Mekoro would like to take a loan for a semoir, which is a local seeding machine that has 2 boxes: one for seed and one for fertilizer.  The semoir is attached to a cow that will pull the semoir along the field, and there are diggers and a pipe behind each box that will place the correct amount of seed and fertilizer the right distance apart.  This enables farmers to plant using the micro-dosing method of planting – using a small amount of fertilizer per plant instead of the traditional method of broadcasting fertilizer.  This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and is much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Mekoro will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income.  

Mekoro would like a semoir because it facilitates good planting with the proper spacing and correct number of seeds and grams of fertilizer per hole.  Before, Mekoro planted manually which was time-consuming and made it difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Mekoro’s goals are to increase his revenue and amount of land he farms next year, send the kids to school, and fix his house.  He hopes one day to buy a motorcycle.  Mekoro says myAgro helps him reach his goals by providing good seed and quality fertilizer and delivering it with good agricultural trainings.  Mekoro will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income. All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.use: To pay for a semoir

loans.name: Samou

texts.en:
Samou is a farmer in Falan Village.  He is 67 years old and married with 10 children.  He is a 2nd year farmer with myAgro and plants maize, cotton, sorghum, and peanuts.  Samou would like to take a loan for a semoir, which is a local seeding machine that has 2 boxes: one for seed and one for fertilizer.  The semoir is attached to a cow that will pull the semoir along the field, and there are diggers and a pipe behind each box that will place the correct amount of seed and fertilizer the right distance apart.  This enables farmers to plant using the micro-dosing method of planting – using a small amount of fertilizer per plant instead of the traditional method of broadcasting fertilizer.  This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and is much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Samou will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income.  

Samou would like a semoir because it is quicker and more efficient, which will allow him to plant more land.  Before, Samou planted manually which was time-consuming and difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Samou’s goals are to purchase a tractor, feed his family, send his children to school, and provide healthcare for his family.  Samou says myAgro helps him reach his goals by ensuring he receives inputs on time and providing agricultural trainings.  Samou will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income.  All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment

loans.name: Broulaye

texts.en:
Broulaye is a farmer in Gwelekoro Village.  He is 44 years old and married with 6 children.  He is a 2nd year farmer with myAgro and plants maize. Broulaye will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income.  All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.
