loans.name: Valentine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Valentine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est la représente de ce groupe. Âgée de 51 ans, Valentine est célibataire avec trois enfants, dont deux à sa charge. Parmi les enfants, certains ont fréquenté l’école. Valentine vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule leurs différentes charges grâce au revenu de son activité. Valentine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assumer ses responsabilités, Valentine vend des divers, de l’igname et des beignets (faits à base de haricot) à son domicile depuis une quinzaine d’années. Valentine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Valentine s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This is a group of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Their representative is Valentine (with her hand raised in the photo), age 51. Valentine is a single mother to three children, two of them still dependent. Some of them have received schooling. Valentine lives alone with her children and supports them all by herself with the income earned through her activity. She never went to school. 

To support herself and her family, Valentine has been selling various items including yams and beignets (bean-based) from her home for about 15 years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To strengthen her activity, she is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy yams and beans.

loans.name: Eugénie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Eugénie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 45 ans. Eugénie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Eugénie est une veuve ayant à sa charge ses trois enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Eugénie vit seule avec ses enfants. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Eugénie vend des divers (sucre, lait, savon, etc.) à son domicile depuis vingt ans. Eugénie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Eugénie s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group consists of three people who live in the same district. The representative of the group is named Eugénie (shown in the photo with her hand raised). She is 45 years old and did not attend school. Eugénie is a widow, and is responsible for the care of her three children. Some of her children attend school. Eugénie lives alone with her children.

To meet her various needs, Eugénie has been selling sundries (sugar, milk, soap, etc.) from her home for the past twenty years. She purchases her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business, Eugénie has joined up with the other members of her group to seek their first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to purchase sundries (sugar, milk, soap, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 57 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requesting an additional loan to build her businesses raising pigs and buying and selling frozen products.  

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 26 years old and married with one child.

Lanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct selling MSE (Marikina Shoe Exchange) products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Lanie has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business direct selling MSE products for three years and also earns an income from a general store.

Lanie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Watti

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Watti works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming vegetables. Watti is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her business.

Watti has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 60 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marina has been raising pigs for six years, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Amylen

texts.en: Amylen, a 29-year-old married mother of three, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for three years to earn a living. She earns additional income selling rice. Amylen is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs as she works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fasseli

texts.en:
Fasseli is a farmer in Tadianabougou Village.  He is 65 years old and married.  He is a 1st year farmer with myAgro.  Fasseli would like to take a loan for a semoir, which is a local seeding machine that has 2 boxes: one for seed and one for fertilizer.  The semoir is attached to a cow that will pull the semoir along the field, and there are diggers and a pipe behind each box that will place the correct amount of seed and fertilizer the right distance apart.  This enables farmers to plant using the micro-dosing method of planting – using a small amount of fertilizer per plant instead of the traditional method of broadcasting fertilizer.  This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and is much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Fasseli will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income.  

Fasseli would like a semoir loan because he can work quickly with it and plant one hectare of land in one day.  Before, Fasseli planted manually which was time-consuming and made it difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Fasseli’s goals are to buy health insurance for his family, send the children to school, increase the land size he plants next year, and one day buy a tractor.  Fasseli says myAgro helps him reach his goals by allowing him to pay for fertilizer and seed packages little by little, which is easier than paying in large sums.  Fasseli will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income.  All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.use: to pay for a semoir

loans.name: Djafe

This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Djafé will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income.   

Djafé would like a semoir loan because it will help him plant quickly and efficiently.  Before, Djafé planted manually which was time-consuming and made it difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Djafé’s goals are to increase the land size he plants, send the children to school, and buy health insurance for the family.  Djafé says myAgro helps him reach his goals by enabling him to pay for his fertilizer and seed little by little and by providing agricultural trainings.  Djafé will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income.  All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Lassine

Lassinè is a farmer in Kandia Village.  He is 64 years old and married with 15 children.  He is a 1st year farmer with myAgro and plants millet, maize, peanuts and vegetables. Lassinè would like a semoir loan because the semoir makes planting quicker and easier.  Before, Lassinè planted manually which was time-consuming and made it difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Lassinè’s goals are to increase the amount of land he plants, buy health insurance for the family, and feed his children.  Lassinè says myAgro helps him reach his goals by providing agricultural trainings.  Lassinè will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income. All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.use: To buy farming equipment

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.en:
Fousseyni is a farmer in Daman Village.  He is 45 years old and married with 10 children.  He is a 1st year farmer with myAgro and plants maize.  Fousseyni would like to take a loan for a semoir, which is a local seeding machine that has 2 boxes: one for seed and one for fertilizer.  The semoir is attached to a cow that will pull the semoir along the field, and there are diggers and a pipe behind each box that will place the correct amount of seed and fertilizer the right distance apart.  This enables farmers to plant using the micro-dosing method of planting – using a small amount of fertilizer per plant instead of the traditional method of broadcasting fertilizer.  This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and is much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Fousseyni will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income.    

Fousseyni would like a semoir because there is a significant difference between manual planting and using a semoir – with a semoir you can get a large harvest because the spacing is correct.  Before, Fousseyni planted manually which was time-consuming and made it difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Fousseyni’s goals are for his family to have enough food to eat all year and to plant a larger area of land next year.  Fousseyni says myAgro helps him reach his goals by continuing to enable farmers to pay for inputs little by little and delivering on time.  Fousseyni will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income.  All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.use: To buy farming equipment

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.en:
Zoumana is a farmer in Daman Village.  He is 68 years old and married with 12 children.  He is a 1st year farmer with myAgro and plants maize.  Zoumana would like to take a loan for a semoir, which is a local seeding machine that has 2 boxes: one for seed and one for fertilizer. This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and is much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Zoumana will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income.   

Zoumana would like a semoir because it would allow him to plant a lot more land. loans.use: To buy farming equipment

loans.name: Oumardjan

texts.en:
Oumardjan is a farmer in Daman Village.  He is 41 years old and married with 7 children.  He is a 1st year farmer with myAgro and plants maize.  Oumardjan would like to take a loan for a semoir, which is a local seeding machine that has 2 boxes: one for seed and one for fertilizer.  The semoir is attached to a cow that will pull the semoir along the field, and there are diggers and a pipe behind each box that will place the correct amount of seed and fertilizer the right distance apart.  This enables farmers to plant using the micro-dosing method of planting – using a small amount of fertilizer per plant instead of the traditional method of broadcasting fertilizer.  This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and is much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Oumardjan will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income.  

Oumardjan would like a semoir because it will help him do his work more quickly and is less expensive than hiring manual labor.  Before, Oumardjan planted manually which was time-consuming and made it difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Oumardjan says, “My dream is to harvest well, take care of the family and sell a little of my harvest for other expenses or other opportunities, like buying land to plant.”  Oumardjan says myAgro helps him reach his goals by providing good agricultural trainings and follow up.  Oumardjan will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income.  All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio tiene 46 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia junto su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Julio, a diario se dirige a los aserraderos ubicados en los alrededores de la ciudad para conseguir madera de buena calidad para ponerlos a la venta, tiene clientes que siempre solicitan su mercadería. Lleva en este negocio desde hace 3 años y todo le está marchando de maravilla. Cumple con esta función todos los días por lo general en las mañanas de lunes a viernes. Agradece que las cosas le están yendo muy bien ya que tiene buenos clientes que a diario lo buscan por la calidad de productos que ofrece, espera seguir trabajando de esta manera y más adelante establecer una pequeña re aserradora. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de maderas traslapadas que son usadas en construcciones de viviendas.
texts.en:
Julio is 46 years old, is married, and lives in his own house with his wife and 3 children. Julio goes to the sawmills in the outskirts of the city every day to get good-quality wood to sell. He has customers who always request his merchandise. He has had this business for 3 years, and everything is going wonderfully. 
He carries out his business activities every day, usually in the mornings from Monday to Friday. He is grateful that things are going very well for him, since he has good clients that seek him out daily because of the quality of the products he offers. He hopes to continue working this way and in the future start a small sawmill. 
On this occasion he is requesting S/. 3800; he is very grateful to all the people who give him this loan, which he needs to achieve his goals. In addition, he promises to make his payments. With the amount he is requesting, he will buy a large quantity of overlapping wooden beams used in the construction of houses.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of overlapping wooden beams to use in the construction of houses.

loans.name: Bon Samaritain 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Paulin, age 43, is married with three children, ages eight to ten years old. Two of the children are currently attending school. 

Paulin is representing the Bon Samaritain 2 (2) Group. Paulin sells vegetables and firewood at a stand. He has had this business for two years. 

He will use the loan to buy tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, and wood to sell. His business strategy is to sell in the market during the dry season and from his home in the rainy season. During the rainy season, there is less produce available to sell and the market is often messy because of the mud. The dry season offers more produce to sell and an easier market to do business in. 

Paulin has received one loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. In the future, he wants to start a charcoal-selling business.

loans.use: to pay for tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, and wood to sell.

The semoir is attached to a cow that will pull the semoir along the field, and there are diggers and a pipe behind each box that will place the correct amount of seed and fertilizer the right distance apart.  This enables farmers to plant using the micro-dosing method of planting – using a small amount of fertilizer per plant instead of the traditional method of broadcasting fertilizer.  This is less expensive since it uses less fertilizer and is much better for land sustainability as well.  myAgro hopes that by providing the semoir on loan, Zantigui will be able to increase the amount of land he plants using the micro-dosing method and significantly increase his farm income. 

Zantigui would like a semoir because it will help him follow a better planting technique, lower his labor costs and hopefully increase his harvests.  Before, Zantigui planted manually which was time-consuming and made it difficult to grow enough food to meet the needs of his family.  Zantigui’s goals are to increase the agricultural tools he has and the number of crops he plants, buy cows, send his children to school, and buy health insurance for his family.  Zantigui will also be able to rent his semoir to others to earn extra income.  All semoirs are covered by a 2-year guarantee that covers most repairs within a 1-week time period.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice-retailing. Lilibeth is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items for her general store business, like bread, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 68 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Salvacion has been raising pigs for 40 years and also earns additional income from a variety store.

Salvacion is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.
